summary.long: Numbers is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, in the tent of meeting, on the first day of the second month, in the second year after they had come out of the land of Egypt, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take a census of all the congregation of the people of Israel, by clans, by fathers' houses, according to the number of names, every male, head by head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From twenty years old and upwards, all in Israel who are able to go to war, you and Aaron shall list them, company by company.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there shall be with you a man from each tribe, each man being the head of the house of his fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And these are the names of the men who shall assist you. From Reuben, Elizur the son of Shedeur;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from Simeon, Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from Judah, Nahshon the son of Amminadab;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from Issachar, Nethanel the son of Zuar;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from Zebulun, Eliab the son of Helon;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the sons of Joseph, from Ephraim, Elishama the son of Ammihud, and from Manasseh, Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from Benjamin, Abidan the son of Gideoni;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from Dan, Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from Asher, Pagiel the son of Ochran;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from Gad, Eliasaph the son of Deuel;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from Naphtali, Ahira the son of Enan.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the ones chosen from the congregation, the chiefs of their ancestral tribes, the heads of the clans of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses and Aaron took these men who had been named,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and on the first day of the second month, they assembled the whole congregation together, who registered themselves by clans, by fathers' houses, according to the number of names from twenty years old and upwards, head by head,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as the Lord commanded Moses. So he listed them in the wilderness of Sinai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people of Reuben, Israel's firstborn, their generations, by their clans, by their fathers' houses, according to the number of names, head by head, every male from twenty years old and upwards, all who were able to go to war:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: those listed of the tribe of Reuben were 46,500.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the people of Simeon, their generations, by their clans, by their fathers' houses, those of them who were listed, according to the number of names, head by head, every male from twenty years old and upwards, all who were able to go to war:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: those listed of the tribe of Simeon were 59,300.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the people of Gad, their generations, by their clans, by their fathers' houses, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upwards, all who were able to go to war:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: those listed of the tribe of Gad were 45,650.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the people of Judah, their generations, by their clans, by their fathers' houses, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and upwards, every man able to go to war:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: those listed of the tribe of Judah were 74,600.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the people of Issachar, their generations, by their clans, by their fathers' houses, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and upwards, every man able to go to war:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: those listed of the tribe of Issachar were 54,400.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the people of Zebulun, their generations, by their clans, by their fathers' houses, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and upwards, every man able to go to war:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: those listed of the tribe of Zebulun were 57,400.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the people of Joseph, namely, of the people of Ephraim, their generations, by their clans, by their fathers' houses, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and upwards, every man able to go to war:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: those listed of the tribe of Ephraim were 40,500.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the people of Manasseh, their generations, by their clans, by their fathers' houses, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and upwards, every man able to go to war:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: those listed of the tribe of Manasseh were 32,200.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the people of Benjamin, their generations, by their clans, by their fathers' houses, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and upwards, every man able to go to war:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: those listed of the tribe of Benjamin were 35,400.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the people of Dan, their generations, by their clans, by their fathers' houses, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and upwards, every man able to go to war:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: those listed of the tribe of Dan were 62,700.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the people of Asher, their generations, by their clans, by their fathers' houses, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and upwards, every man able to go to war:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: those listed of the tribe of Asher were 41,500.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the people of Naphtali, their generations, by their clans, by their fathers' houses, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and upwards, every man able to go to war:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: those listed of the tribe of Naphtali were 53,400.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are those who were listed, whom Moses and Aaron listed with the help of the chiefs of Israel, twelve men, each representing his fathers' house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all those listed of the people of Israel, by their fathers' houses, from twenty years old and upwards, every man able to go to war in Israel—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all those listed were 603,550.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Levites were not listed along with them by their ancestral tribe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Only the tribe of Levi you shall not list, and you shall not take a census of them among the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But appoint the Levites over the tabernacle of the testimony, and over all its furnishings, and over all that belongs to it. They are to carry the tabernacle and all its furnishings, and they shall take care of it and shall camp round the tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the tabernacle is to set out, the Levites shall take it down, and when the tabernacle is to be pitched, the Levites shall set it up. And if any outsider comes near, he shall be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people of Israel shall pitch their tents by their companies, each man in his own camp and each man by his own standard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Levites shall camp round the tabernacle of the testimony, so that there may be no wrath on the congregation of the people of Israel. And the Levites shall keep guard over the tabernacle of the testimony.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus did the people of Israel; they did according to all that the Lord commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The people of Israel shall camp each by his own standard, with the banners of their fathers' houses. They shall camp facing the tent of meeting on every side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those to camp on the east side towards the sunrise shall be of the standard of the camp of Judah by their companies, the chief of the people of Judah being Nahshon the son of Amminadab,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his company as listed being 74,600.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those to camp next to him shall be the tribe of Issachar, the chief of the people of Issachar being Nethanel the son of Zuar,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his company as listed being 54,400.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the tribe of Zebulun, the chief of the people of Zebulun being Eliab the son of Helon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his company as listed being 57,400.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All those listed of the camp of Judah, by their companies, were 186,400. They shall set out first on the march.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On the south side shall be the standard of the camp of Reuben by their companies, the chief of the people of Reuben being Elizur the son of Shedeur,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his company as listed being 46,500.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those to camp next to him shall be the tribe of Simeon, the chief of the people of Simeon being Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his company as listed being 59,300.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the tribe of Gad, the chief of the people of Gad being Eliasaph the son of Reuel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his company as listed being 45,650.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All those listed of the camp of Reuben, by their companies, were 151,450. They shall set out second.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then the tent of meeting shall set out, with the camp of the Levites in the midst of the camps; as they camp, so shall they set out, each in position, standard by standard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On the west side shall be the standard of the camp of Ephraim by their companies, the chief of the people of Ephraim being Elishama the son of Ammihud,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his company as listed being 40,500.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And next to him shall be the tribe of Manasseh, the chief of the people of Manasseh being Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his company as listed being 32,200.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the tribe of Benjamin, the chief of the people of Benjamin being Abidan the son of Gideoni,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his company as listed being 35,400.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All those listed of the camp of Ephraim, by their companies, were 108,100. They shall set out third on the march.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On the north side shall be the standard of the camp of Dan by their companies, the chief of the people of Dan being Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his company as listed being 62,700.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those to camp next to him shall be the tribe of Asher, the chief of the people of Asher being Pagiel the son of Ochran,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his company as listed being 41,500.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the tribe of Naphtali, the chief of the people of Naphtali being Ahira the son of Enan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his company as listed being 53,400.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All those listed of the camp of Dan were 157,600. They shall set out last, standard by standard.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the people of Israel as listed by their fathers' houses. All those listed in the camps by their companies were 603,550.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Levites were not listed among the people of Israel, as the Lord commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus did the people of Israel. According to all that the Lord commanded Moses, so they camped by their standards, and so they set out, each one in his clan, according to his fathers' house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the generations of Aaron and Moses at the time when the Lord spoke with Moses on Mount Sinai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the names of the sons of Aaron: Nadab the firstborn, and Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the names of the sons of Aaron, the anointed priests, whom he ordained to serve as priests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Nadab and Abihu died before the Lord when they offered unauthorized fire before the Lord in the wilderness of Sinai, and they had no children. So Eleazar and Ithamar served as priests in the lifetime of Aaron their father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Bring the tribe of Levi near, and set them before Aaron the priest, that they may minister to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall keep guard over him and over the whole congregation before the tent of meeting, as they minister at the tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall guard all the furnishings of the tent of meeting, and keep guard over the people of Israel as they minister at the tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall give the Levites to Aaron and his sons; they are wholly given to him from among the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall appoint Aaron and his sons, and they shall guard their priesthood. But if any outsider comes near, he shall be put to death.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, I have taken the Levites from among the people of Israel instead of every firstborn who opens the womb among the people of Israel. The Levites shall be mine,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for all the firstborn are mine. On the day that I struck down all the firstborn in the land of Egypt, I consecrated for my own all the firstborn in Israel, both of man and of beast. They shall be mine: I am the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spoke to Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “List the sons of Levi, by fathers' houses and by clans; every male from a month old and upwards you shall list.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses listed them according to the word of the Lord, as he was commanded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And these were the sons of Levi by their names: Gershon and Kohath and Merari.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And these are the names of the sons of Gershon by their clans: Libni and Shimei.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Kohath by their clans: Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Merari by their clans: Mahli and Mushi. These are the clans of the Levites, by their fathers' houses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To Gershon belonged the clan of the Libnites and the clan of the Shimeites; these were the clans of the Gershonites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their listing according to the number of all the males from a month old and upwards was 7,500.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The clans of the Gershonites were to camp behind the tabernacle on the west,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with Eliasaph, the son of Lael as chief of the fathers' house of the Gershonites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the guard duty of the sons of Gershon in the tent of meeting involved the tabernacle, the tent with its covering, the screen for the entrance of the tent of meeting,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the hangings of the court, the screen for the door of the court that is round the tabernacle and the altar, and its cords—all the service connected with these.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To Kohath belonged the clan of the Amramites and the clan of the Izharites and the clan of the Hebronites and the clan of the Uzzielites; these are the clans of the Kohathites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: According to the number of all the males, from a month old and upwards, there were 8,600, keeping guard over the sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The clans of the sons of Kohath were to camp on the south side of the tabernacle,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with Elizaphan the son of Uzziel as chief of the fathers' house of the clans of the Kohathites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And their guard duty involved the ark, the table, the lampstand, the altars, the vessels of the sanctuary with which the priests minister, and the screen; all the service connected with these.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Eleazar the son of Aaron the priest was to be chief over the chiefs of the Levites, and to have oversight of those who kept guard over the sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To Merari belonged the clan of the Mahlites and the clan of the Mushites: these are the clans of Merari.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their listing according to the number of all the males from a month old and upwards was 6,200.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the chief of the fathers' house of the clans of Merari was Zuriel the son of Abihail. They were to camp on the north side of the tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the appointed guard duty of the sons of Merari involved the frames of the tabernacle, the bars, the pillars, the bases, and all their accessories; all the service connected with these;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: also the pillars round the court, with their bases and pegs and cords.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who were to camp before the tabernacle on the east, before the tent of meeting towards the sunrise, were Moses and Aaron and his sons, guarding the sanctuary itself, to protect the people of Israel. And any outsider who came near was to be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All those listed among the Levites, whom Moses and Aaron listed at the commandment of the Lord, by clans, all the males from a month old and upwards, were 22,000.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to Moses, “List all the firstborn males of the people of Israel, from a month old and upwards, taking the number of their names.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall take the Levites for me—I am the Lord—instead of all the firstborn among the people of Israel, and the cattle of the Levites instead of all the firstborn among the cattle of the people of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses listed all the firstborn among the people of Israel, as the Lord commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the firstborn males, according to the number of names, from a month old and upwards as listed were 22,273.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take the Levites instead of all the firstborn among the people of Israel, and the cattle of the Levites instead of their cattle. The Levites shall be mine: I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as the redemption price for the 273 of the firstborn of the people of Israel, over and above the number of the male Levites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you shall take five shekels per head; you shall take them according to the shekel of the sanctuary (the shekel of twenty gerahs),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and give the money to Aaron and his sons as the redemption price for those who are over.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses took the redemption money from those who were over and above those redeemed by the Levites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the firstborn of the people of Israel he took the money, 1,365 shekels, by the shekel of the sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses gave the redemption money to Aaron and his sons, according to the word of the Lord, as the Lord commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take a census of the sons of Kohath from among the sons of Levi, by their clans and their fathers' houses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from thirty years old up to fifty years old, all who can come on duty, to do the work in the tent of meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the service of the sons of Kohath in the tent of meeting: the most holy things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the camp is to set out, Aaron and his sons shall go in and take down the veil of the screen and cover the ark of the testimony with it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they shall put on it a covering of goatskin and spread on top of that a cloth all of blue, and shall put in its poles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And over the table of the bread of the Presence they shall spread a cloth of blue and put on it the plates, the dishes for incense, the bowls, and the flagons for the drink offering; the regular show bread also shall be on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they shall spread over them a cloth of scarlet and cover the same with a covering of goatskin, and shall put in its poles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall take a cloth of blue and cover the lampstand for the light, with its lamps, its tongs, its trays, and all the vessels for oil with which it is supplied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall put it with all its utensils in a covering of goatskin and put it on the carrying frame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And over the golden altar they shall spread a cloth of blue and cover it with a covering of goatskin, and shall put in its poles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall take all the vessels of the service that are used in the sanctuary and put them in a cloth of blue and cover them with a covering of goatskin and put them on the carrying frame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall take away the ashes from the altar and spread a purple cloth over it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall put on it all the utensils of the altar, which are used for the service there, the firepans, the forks, the shovels, and the basins, all the utensils of the altar; and they shall spread on it a covering of goatskin, and shall put in its poles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Aaron and his sons have finished covering the sanctuary and all the furnishings of the sanctuary, as the camp sets out, after that the sons of Kohath shall come to carry these, but they must not touch the holy things, lest they die. These are the things of the tent of meeting that the sons of Kohath are to carry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And Eleazar the son of Aaron the priest shall have charge of the oil for the light, the fragrant incense, the regular grain offering, and the anointing oil, with the oversight of the whole tabernacle and all that is in it, of the sanctuary and its vessels.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Let not the tribe of the clans of the Kohathites be destroyed from among the Levites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but deal thus with them, that they may live and not die when they come near to the most holy things: Aaron and his sons shall go in and appoint them each to his task and to his burden,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but they shall not go in to look on the holy things even for a moment, lest they die.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take a census of the sons of Gershon also, by their fathers' houses and by their clans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From thirty years old up to fifty years old, you shall list them, all who can come to do duty, to do service in the tent of meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the service of the clans of the Gershonites, in serving and bearing burdens:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they shall carry the curtains of the tabernacle and the tent of meeting with its covering and the covering of goatskin that is on top of it and the screen for the entrance of the tent of meeting
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the hangings of the court and the screen for the entrance of the gate of the court that is round the tabernacle and the altar, and their cords and all the equipment for their service. And they shall do all that needs to be done with regard to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the service of the sons of the Gershonites shall be at the command of Aaron and his sons, in all that they are to carry and in all that they have to do. And you shall assign to their charge all that they are to carry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the service of the clans of the sons of the Gershonites in the tent of meeting, and their guard duty is to be under the direction of Ithamar the son of Aaron the priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As for the sons of Merari, you shall list them by their clans and their fathers' houses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From thirty years old up to fifty years old, you shall list them, everyone who can come on duty, to do the service of the tent of meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this is what they are charged to carry, as the whole of their service in the tent of meeting: the frames of the tabernacle, with its bars, pillars, and bases,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the pillars round the court with their bases, pegs, and cords, with all their equipment and all their accessories. And you shall list by name the objects that they are required to carry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the service of the clans of the sons of Merari, the whole of their service in the tent of meeting, under the direction of Ithamar the son of Aaron the priest.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses and Aaron and the chiefs of the congregation listed the sons of the Kohathites, by their clans and their fathers' houses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from thirty years old up to fifty years old, everyone who could come on duty, for service in the tent of meeting;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and those listed by clans were 2,750.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was the list of the clans of the Kohathites, all who served in the tent of meeting, whom Moses and Aaron listed according to the commandment of the Lord by Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those listed of the sons of Gershon, by their clans and their fathers' houses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from thirty years old up to fifty years old, everyone who could come on duty for service in the tent of meeting—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: those listed by their clans and their fathers' houses were 2,630.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was the list of the clans of the sons of Gershon, all who served in the tent of meeting, whom Moses and Aaron listed according to the commandment of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those listed of the clans of the sons of Merari, by their clans and their fathers' houses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from thirty years old up to fifty years old, everyone who could come on duty, for service in the tent of meeting—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: those listed by clans were 3,200.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was the list of the clans of the sons of Merari, whom Moses and Aaron listed according to the commandment of the Lord by Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All those who were listed of the Levites, whom Moses and Aaron and the chiefs of Israel listed, by their clans and their fathers' houses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from thirty years old up to fifty years old, everyone who could come to do the service of ministry and the service of bearing burdens in the tent of meeting,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: those listed were 8,580.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: According to the commandment of the Lord through Moses they were listed, each one with his task of serving or carrying. Thus they were listed by him, as the Lord commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Command the people of Israel that they put out of the camp everyone who is leprous or has a discharge and everyone who is unclean through contact with the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall put out both male and female, putting them outside the camp, that they may not defile their camp, in the midst of which I dwell.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people of Israel did so, and put them outside the camp; as the Lord said to Moses, so the people of Israel did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to the people of Israel, When a man or woman commits any of the sins that people commit by breaking faith with the Lord, and that person realizes his guilt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he shall confess his sin that he has committed. And he shall make full restitution for his wrong, adding a fifth to it and giving it to him to whom he did the wrong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the man has no next of kin to whom restitution may be made for the wrong, the restitution for wrong shall go to the Lord for the priest, in addition to the ram of atonement with which atonement is made for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And every contribution, all the holy donations of the people of Israel, which they bring to the priest, shall be his.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each one shall keep his holy donations: whatever anyone gives to the priest shall be his.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to the people of Israel, If any man's wife goes astray and breaks faith with him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if a man lies with her sexually, and it is hidden from the eyes of her husband, and she is undetected though she has defiled herself, and there is no witness against her, since she was not taken in the act,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if the spirit of jealousy comes over him and he is jealous of his wife who has defiled herself, or if the spirit of jealousy comes over him and he is jealous of his wife, though she has not defiled herself,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then the man shall bring his wife to the priest and bring the offering required of her, a tenth of an ephah of barley flour. He shall pour no oil on it and put no frankincense on it, for it is a grain offering of jealousy, a grain offering of remembrance, bringing iniquity to remembrance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And the priest shall bring her near and set her before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the priest shall take holy water in an earthenware vessel and take some of the dust that is on the floor of the tabernacle and put it into the water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the priest shall set the woman before the Lord and unbind the hair of the woman's head and place in her hands the grain offering of remembrance, which is the grain offering of jealousy. And in his hand the priest shall have the water of bitterness that brings the curse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the priest shall make her take an oath, saying, ‘If no man has lain with you, and if you have not turned aside to uncleanness while you were under your husband's authority, be free from this water of bitterness that brings the curse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you have gone astray, though you are under your husband's authority, and if you have defiled yourself, and some man other than your husband has lain with you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then’ (let the priest make the woman take the oath of the curse, and say to the woman) ‘the Lord make you a curse and an oath among your people, when the Lord makes your thigh fall away and your body swell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: May this water that brings the curse pass into your bowels and make your womb swell and your thigh fall away.’ And the woman shall say, ‘Amen, Amen.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then the priest shall write these curses in a book and wash them off into the water of bitterness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he shall make the woman drink the water of bitterness that brings the curse, and the water that brings the curse shall enter into her and cause bitter pain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the priest shall take the grain offering of jealousy out of the woman's hand and shall wave the grain offering before the Lord and bring it to the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the priest shall take a handful of the grain offering, as its memorial portion, and burn it on the altar, and afterwards shall make the woman drink the water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he has made her drink the water, then, if she has defiled herself and has broken faith with her husband, the water that brings the curse shall enter into her and cause bitter pain, and her womb shall swell, and her thigh shall fall away, and the woman shall become a curse among her people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the woman has not defiled herself and is clean, then she shall be free and shall conceive children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is the law in cases of jealousy, when a wife, though under her husband's authority, goes astray and defiles herself,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or when the spirit of jealousy comes over a man and he is jealous of his wife. Then he shall set the woman before the Lord, and the priest shall carry out for her all this law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man shall be free from iniquity, but the woman shall bear her iniquity.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to the people of Israel and say to them, When either a man or a woman makes a special vow, the vow of a Nazirite, to separate himself to the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he shall separate himself from wine and strong drink. He shall drink no vinegar made from wine or strong drink and shall not drink any juice of grapes or eat grapes, fresh or dried.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the days of his separation he shall eat nothing that is produced by the grapevine, not even the seeds or the skins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “All the days of his vow of separation, no razor shall touch his head. Until the time is completed for which he separates himself to the Lord, he shall be holy. He shall let the locks of hair of his head grow long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “All the days that he separates himself to the Lord he shall not go near a dead body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Not even for his father or for his mother, for brother or sister, if they die, shall he make himself unclean, because his separation to God is on his head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the days of his separation he is holy to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And if any man dies very suddenly beside him and he defiles his consecrated head, then he shall shave his head on the day of his cleansing; on the seventh day he shall shave it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the eighth day he shall bring two turtle-doves or two pigeons to the priest to the entrance of the tent of meeting,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the priest shall offer one for a sin offering and the other for a burnt offering, and make atonement for him, because he sinned by reason of the dead body. And he shall consecrate his head that same day
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and separate himself to the Lord for the days of his separation and bring a male lamb a year old for a guilt offering. But the previous period shall be void, because his separation was defiled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And this is the law for the Nazirite, when the time of his separation has been completed: he shall be brought to the entrance of the tent of meeting,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he shall bring his gift to the Lord, one male lamb a year old without blemish for a burnt offering, and one ewe lamb a year old without blemish as a sin offering, and one ram without blemish as a peace offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a basket of unleavened bread, loaves of fine flour mixed with oil, and unleavened wafers smeared with oil, and their grain offering and their drink offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the priest shall bring them before the Lord and offer his sin offering and his burnt offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he shall offer the ram as a sacrifice of peace offering to the Lord, with the basket of unleavened bread. The priest shall offer also its grain offering and its drink offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Nazirite shall shave his consecrated head at the entrance of the tent of meeting and shall take the hair from his consecrated head and put it on the fire that is under the sacrifice of the peace offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the priest shall take the shoulder of the ram, when it is boiled, and one unleavened loaf out of the basket and one unleavened wafer, and shall put them on the hands of the Nazirite, after he has shaved the hair of his consecration,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the priest shall wave them for a wave offering before the Lord. They are a holy portion for the priest, together with the breast that is waved and the thigh that is contributed. And after that the Nazirite may drink wine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is the law of the Nazirite. But if he vows an offering to the Lord above his Nazirite vow, as he can afford, in exact accordance with the vow that he takes, then he shall do in addition to the law of the Nazirite.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to Aaron and his sons, saying, Thus you shall bless the people of Israel: you shall say to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord bless you and keep you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Lord make his face to shine upon you and be gracious to you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Lord lift up his countenance upon you and give you peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So shall they put my name upon the people of Israel, and I will bless them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the day when Moses had finished setting up the tabernacle and had anointed and consecrated it with all its furnishings and had anointed and consecrated the altar with all its utensils,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the chiefs of Israel, heads of their fathers' houses, who were the chiefs of the tribes, who were over those who were listed, approached
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and brought their offerings before the Lord, six wagons and twelve oxen, a wagon for every two of the chiefs, and for each one an ox. They brought them before the tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Accept these from them, that they may be used in the service of the tent of meeting, and give them to the Levites, to each man according to his service.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses took the wagons and the oxen and gave them to the Levites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Two wagons and four oxen he gave to the sons of Gershon, according to their service.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And four wagons and eight oxen he gave to the sons of Merari, according to their service, under the direction of Ithamar the son of Aaron the priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But to the sons of Kohath he gave none, because they were charged with the service of the holy things that had to be carried on the shoulder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the chiefs offered offerings for the dedication of the altar on the day it was anointed; and the chiefs offered their offering before the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to Moses, “They shall offer their offerings, one chief each day, for the dedication of the altar.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who offered his offering on the first day was Nahshon the son of Amminadab, of the tribe of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his offering was one silver plate whose weight was 130 shekels, one silver basin of 70 shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil for a grain offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one golden dish of 10 shekels, full of incense;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one bull from the herd, one ram, one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one male goat for a sin offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Nahshon the son of Amminadab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the second day Nethanel the son of Zuar, the chief of Issachar, made an offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He offered for his offering one silver plate whose weight was 130 shekels, one silver basin of 70 shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil for a grain offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one golden dish of 10 shekels, full of incense;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one bull from the herd, one ram, one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one male goat for a sin offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Nethanel the son of Zuar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the third day Eliab the son of Helon, the chief of the people of Zebulun:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his offering was one silver plate whose weight was 130 shekels, one silver basin of 70 shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil for a grain offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one golden dish of 10 shekels, full of incense;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one bull from the herd, one ram, one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one male goat for a sin offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Eliab the son of Helon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the fourth day Elizur the son of Shedeur, the chief of the people of Reuben:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his offering was one silver plate whose weight was 130 shekels, one silver basin of 70 shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil for a grain offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one golden dish of 10 shekels, full of incense;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one bull from the herd, one ram, one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one male goat for a sin offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Elizur the son of Shedeur.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the fifth day Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai, the chief of the people of Simeon:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his offering was one silver plate whose weight was 130 shekels, one silver basin of 70 shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil for a grain offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one golden dish of 10 shekels, full of incense;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one bull from the herd, one ram, one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one male goat for a sin offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the sixth day Eliasaph the son of Deuel, the chief of the people of Gad:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his offering was one silver plate whose weight was 130 shekels, one silver basin of 70 shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil for a grain offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one golden dish of 10 shekels, full of incense;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one bull from the herd, one ram, one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one male goat for a sin offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Eliasaph the son of Deuel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the seventh day Elishama the son of Ammihud, the chief of the people of Ephraim:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his offering was one silver plate whose weight was 130 shekels, one silver basin of 70 shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil for a grain offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one golden dish of 10 shekels, full of incense;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one bull from the herd, one ram, one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one male goat for a sin offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Elishama the son of Ammihud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the eighth day Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur, the chief of the people of Manasseh:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his offering was one silver plate whose weight was 130 shekels, one silver basin of 70 shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil for a grain offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one golden dish of 10 shekels, full of incense;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one bull from the herd, one ram, one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one male goat for a sin offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the ninth day Abidan the son of Gideoni, the chief of the people of Benjamin:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his offering was one silver plate whose weight was 130 shekels, one silver basin of 70 shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil for a grain offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one golden dish of 10 shekels, full of incense;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one bull from the herd, one ram, one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one male goat for a sin offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Abidan the son of Gideoni.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the tenth day Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai, the chief of the people of Dan:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his offering was one silver plate whose weight was 130 shekels, one silver basin of 70 shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil for a grain offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one golden dish of 10 shekels, full of incense;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one bull from the herd, one ram, one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one male goat for a sin offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the eleventh day Pagiel the son of Ochran, the chief of the people of Asher:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his offering was one silver plate whose weight was 130 shekels, one silver basin of 70 shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil for a grain offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one golden dish of 10 shekels, full of incense;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one bull from the herd, one ram, one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one male goat for a sin offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Pagiel the son of Ochran.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the twelfth day Ahira the son of Enan, the chief of the people of Naphtali:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his offering was one silver plate whose weight was 130 shekels, one silver basin of 70 shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil for a grain offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one golden dish of 10 shekels, full of incense;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one bull from the herd, one ram, one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one male goat for a sin offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Ahira the son of Enan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was the dedication offering for the altar on the day when it was anointed, from the chiefs of Israel: twelve silver plates, twelve silver basins, twelve golden dishes,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: each silver plate weighing 130 shekels and each basin 70, all the silver of the vessels 2,400 shekels according to the shekel of the sanctuary,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the twelve golden dishes, full of incense, weighing 10 shekels apiece according to the shekel of the sanctuary, all the gold of the dishes being 120 shekels;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all the cattle for the burnt offering twelve bulls, twelve rams, twelve male lambs a year old, with their grain offering; and twelve male goats for a sin offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all the cattle for the sacrifice of peace offerings twenty-four bulls, the rams sixty, the male goats sixty, the male lambs a year old sixty. This was the dedication offering for the altar after it was anointed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Moses went into the tent of meeting to speak with the Lord, he heard the voice speaking to him from above the mercy seat that was on the ark of the testimony, from between the two cherubim; and it spoke to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to Aaron and say to him, When you set up the lamps, the seven lamps shall give light in front of the lampstand.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Aaron did so: he set up its lamps in front of the lampstand, as the Lord commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this was the workmanship of the lampstand, hammered work of gold. From its base to its flowers, it was hammered work; according to the pattern that the Lord had shown Moses, so he made the lampstand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take the Levites from among the people of Israel and cleanse them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus you shall do to them to cleanse them: sprinkle the water of purification upon them, and let them go with a razor over all their body, and wash their clothes and cleanse themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then let them take a bull from the herd and its grain offering of fine flour mixed with oil, and you shall take another bull from the herd for a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall bring the Levites before the tent of meeting and assemble the whole congregation of the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you bring the Levites before the Lord, the people of Israel shall lay their hands on the Levites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Aaron shall offer the Levites before the Lord as a wave offering from the people of Israel, that they may do the service of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Levites shall lay their hands on the heads of the bulls, and you shall offer one for a sin offering and the other for a burnt offering to the Lord to make atonement for the Levites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall set the Levites before Aaron and his sons, and shall offer them as a wave offering to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus you shall separate the Levites from among the people of Israel, and the Levites shall be mine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after that the Levites shall go in to serve at the tent of meeting, when you have cleansed them and offered them as a wave offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they are wholly given to me from among the people of Israel. Instead of all who open the womb, the firstborn of all the people of Israel, I have taken them for myself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For all the firstborn among the people of Israel are mine, both of man and of beast. On the day that I struck down all the firstborn in the land of Egypt I consecrated them for myself,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I have taken the Levites instead of all the firstborn among the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I have given the Levites as a gift to Aaron and his sons from among the people of Israel, to do the service for the people of Israel at the tent of meeting and to make atonement for the people of Israel, that there may be no plague among the people of Israel when the people of Israel come near the sanctuary.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus did Moses and Aaron and all the congregation of the people of Israel to the Levites. According to all that the Lord commanded Moses concerning the Levites, the people of Israel did to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Levites purified themselves from sin and washed their clothes, and Aaron offered them as a wave offering before the Lord, and Aaron made atonement for them to cleanse them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after that the Levites went in to do their service in the tent of meeting before Aaron and his sons; as the Lord had commanded Moses concerning the Levites, so they did to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This applies to the Levites: from twenty-five years old and upwards they shall come to do duty in the service of the tent of meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And from the age of fifty years they shall withdraw from the duty of the service and serve no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They minister to their brothers in the tent of meeting by keeping guard, but they shall do no service. Thus shall you do to the Levites in assigning their duties.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spoke to Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, in the first month of the second year after they had come out of the land of Egypt, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Let the people of Israel keep the Passover at its appointed time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the fourteenth day of this month, at twilight, you shall keep it at its appointed time; according to all its statutes and all its rules you shall keep it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses told the people of Israel that they should keep the Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they kept the Passover in the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month, at twilight, in the wilderness of Sinai; according to all that the Lord commanded Moses, so the people of Israel did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there were certain men who were unclean through touching a dead body, so that they could not keep the Passover on that day, and they came before Moses and Aaron on that day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those men said to him, “We are unclean through touching a dead body. Why are we kept from bringing the Lord's offering at its appointed time among the people of Israel?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said to them, “Wait, that I may hear what the Lord will command concerning you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to the people of Israel, saying, If any one of you or of your descendants is unclean through touching a dead body, or is on a long journey, he shall still keep the Passover to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the second month on the fourteenth day at twilight they shall keep it. They shall eat it with unleavened bread and bitter herbs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall leave none of it until the morning, nor break any of its bones; according to all the statute for the Passover they shall keep it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if anyone who is clean and is not on a journey fails to keep the Passover, that person shall be cut off from his people because he did not bring the Lord's offering at its appointed time; that man shall bear his sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if a stranger sojourns among you and would keep the Passover to the Lord, according to the statute of the Passover and according to its rule, so shall he do. You shall have one statute, both for the sojourner and for the native.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the day that the tabernacle was set up, the cloud covered the tabernacle, the tent of the testimony. And at evening it was over the tabernacle like the appearance of fire until morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So it was always: the cloud covered it by day and the appearance of fire by night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whenever the cloud lifted from over the tent, after that the people of Israel set out, and in the place where the cloud settled down, there the people of Israel camped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the command of the Lord the people of Israel set out, and at the command of the Lord they camped. As long as the cloud rested over the tabernacle, they remained in camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even when the cloud continued over the tabernacle for many days, the people of Israel kept the charge of the Lord and did not set out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sometimes the cloud would remain for a few days over the tabernacle, and according to the command of the Lord they remained in camp; then according to the command of the Lord they set out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And sometimes the cloud remained from evening until morning. And when the cloud lifted in the morning, they set out, or if it continued for a day and a night, when the cloud lifted they set out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whether it was two days, or a month, or a longer time, that the cloud continued over the tabernacle, abiding there, the people of Israel remained in camp and did not set out, but when it lifted they set out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the command of the Lord they camped, and at the command of the Lord they set out. They kept the charge of the Lord, at the command of the Lord by Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Make two silver trumpets. Of hammered work you shall make them, and you shall use them for summoning the congregation and for breaking camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when both are blown, all the congregation shall gather themselves to you at the entrance of the tent of meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if they blow only one, then the chiefs, the heads of the tribes of Israel, shall gather themselves to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you blow an alarm, the camps that are on the east side shall set out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when you blow an alarm the second time, the camps that are on the south side shall set out. An alarm is to be blown whenever they are to set out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the assembly is to be gathered together, you shall blow a long blast, but you shall not sound an alarm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Aaron, the priests, shall blow the trumpets. The trumpets shall be to you for a perpetual statute throughout your generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when you go to war in your land against the adversary who oppresses you, then you shall sound an alarm with the trumpets, that you may be remembered before the Lord your God, and you shall be saved from your enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the day of your gladness also, and at your appointed feasts and at the beginnings of your months, you shall blow the trumpets over your burnt offerings and over the sacrifices of your peace offerings. They shall be a reminder of you before your God: I am the Lord your God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the second year, in the second month, on the twentieth day of the month, the cloud lifted from over the tabernacle of the testimony,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the people of Israel set out by stages from the wilderness of Sinai. And the cloud settled down in the wilderness of Paran.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They set out for the first time at the command of the Lord by Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The standard of the camp of the people of Judah set out first by their companies, and over their company was Nahshon the son of Amminadab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And over the company of the tribe of the people of Issachar was Nethanel the son of Zuar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And over the company of the tribe of the people of Zebulun was Eliab the son of Helon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the tabernacle was taken down, the sons of Gershon and the sons of Merari, who carried the tabernacle, set out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the standard of the camp of Reuben set out by their companies, and over their company was Elizur the son of Shedeur.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And over the company of the tribe of the people of Simeon was Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And over the company of the tribe of the people of Gad was Eliasaph the son of Deuel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Kohathites set out, carrying the holy things, and the tabernacle was set up before their arrival.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the standard of the camp of the people of Ephraim set out by their companies, and over their company was Elishama the son of Ammihud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And over the company of the tribe of the people of Manasseh was Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And over the company of the tribe of the people of Benjamin was Abidan the son of Gideoni.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the standard of the camp of the people of Dan, acting as the rearguard of all the camps, set out by their companies, and over their company was Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And over the company of the tribe of the people of Asher was Pagiel the son of Ochran.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And over the company of the tribe of the people of Naphtali was Ahira the son of Enan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was the order of march of the people of Israel by their companies, when they set out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said to Hobab the son of Reuel the Midianite, Moses' father-in-law, “We are setting out for the place of which the Lord said, ‘I will give it to you.’ Come with us, and we will do good to you, for the Lord has promised good to Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said to him, “I will not go. I will depart to my own land and to my kindred.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “Please do not leave us, for you know where we should camp in the wilderness, and you will serve as eyes for us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if you do go with us, whatever good the Lord will do to us, the same will we do to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they set out from the mount of the Lord for three days' journey. And the ark of the covenant of the Lord went before them for three days' journey, to seek out a resting-place for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the cloud of the Lord was over them by day, whenever they set out from the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whenever the ark set out, Moses said, “Arise, O Lord, and let your enemies be scattered, and let those who hate you flee before you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when it rested, he said, “Return, O Lord, to the ten thousand thousands of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people complained in the hearing of the Lord about their misfortunes, and when the Lord heard it, his anger was kindled, and the fire of the Lord burned among them and consumed some outlying parts of the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the people cried out to Moses, and Moses prayed to the Lord, and the fire died down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the name of that place was called Taberah, because the fire of the Lord burned among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the rabble that was among them had a strong craving. And the people of Israel also wept again and said, “Oh that we had meat to eat!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We remember the fish we ate in Egypt that cost nothing, the cucumbers, the melons, the leeks, the onions, and the garlic.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now our strength is dried up, and there is nothing at all but this manna to look at.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the manna was like coriander seed, and its appearance like that of bdellium.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people went about and gathered it and ground it in handmills or beat it in mortars and boiled it in pots and made cakes of it. And the taste of it was like the taste of cakes baked with oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the dew fell upon the camp in the night, the manna fell with it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses heard the people weeping throughout their clans, each one at the door of his tent. And the anger of the Lord blazed hotly, and Moses was displeased.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses said to the Lord, “Why have you dealt ill with your servant? And why have I not found favour in your sight, that you lay the burden of all this people on me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Did I conceive all this people? Did I give them birth, that you should say to me, ‘Carry them in your bosom, as a nurse carries a sucking child,’ to the land that you swore to give their fathers?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Where am I to get meat to give to all this people? For they weep before me and say, ‘Give us meat, that we may eat.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am not able to carry all this people alone; the burden is too heavy for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you will treat me like this, kill me at once, if I find favour in your sight, that I may not see my wretchedness.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Gather for me seventy men of the elders of Israel, whom you know to be the elders of the people and officers over them, and bring them to the tent of meeting, and let them take their stand there with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will come down and talk with you there. And I will take some of the Spirit that is on you and put it on them, and they shall bear the burden of the people with you, so that you may not bear it yourself alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And say to the people, ‘Consecrate yourselves for tomorrow, and you shall eat meat, for you have wept in the hearing of the Lord, saying, “Who will give us meat to eat? For it was better for us in Egypt.” Therefore the Lord will give you meat, and you shall eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not eat for just one day, or two days, or five days, or ten days, or twenty days,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but for a whole month, until it comes out at your nostrils and becomes loathsome to you, because you have rejected the Lord who is among you and have wept before him, saying, “Why did we come out of Egypt?”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Moses said, “The people among whom I am number six hundred thousand on foot, and you have said, ‘I will give them meat, that they may eat for a whole month!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shall flocks and herds be slaughtered for them, and be enough for them? Or shall all the fish of the sea be gathered together for them, and be enough for them?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to Moses, “Is the Lord's hand shortened? Now you shall see whether my word will come true for you or not.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses went out and told the people the words of the Lord. And he gathered seventy men of the elders of the people and placed them round the tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord came down in the cloud and spoke to him, and took some of the Spirit that was on him and put it on the seventy elders. And as soon as the Spirit rested on them, they prophesied. But they did not continue doing it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now two men remained in the camp, one named Eldad, and the other named Medad, and the Spirit rested on them. They were among those registered, but they had not gone out to the tent, and so they prophesied in the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a young man ran and told Moses, “Eldad and Medad are prophesying in the camp.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joshua the son of Nun, the assistant of Moses from his youth, said, “My lord Moses, stop them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Moses said to him, “Are you jealous for my sake? Would that all the Lord's people were prophets, that the Lord would put his Spirit on them!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses and the elders of Israel returned to the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a wind from the Lord sprang up, and it brought quail from the sea and let them fall beside the camp, about a day's journey on this side and a day's journey on the other side, round the camp, and about two cubits above the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people rose all that day and all night and all the next day, and gathered the quail. Those who gathered least gathered ten homers. And they spread them out for themselves all round the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While the meat was yet between their teeth, before it was consumed, the anger of the Lord was kindled against the people, and the Lord struck down the people with a very great plague.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the name of that place was called Kibroth-hattaavah, because there they buried the people who had the craving.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Kibroth-hattaavah the people journeyed to Hazeroth, and they remained at Hazeroth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Miriam and Aaron spoke against Moses because of the Cushite woman whom he had married, for he had married a Cushite woman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said, “Has the Lord indeed spoken only through Moses? Has he not spoken through us also?” And the Lord heard it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the man Moses was very meek, more than all people who were on the face of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And suddenly the Lord said to Moses and to Aaron and Miriam, “Come out, you three, to the tent of meeting.” And the three of them came out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord came down in a pillar of cloud and stood at the entrance of the tent and called Aaron and Miriam, and they both came forward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “Hear my words: If there is a prophet among you, I the Lord make myself known to him in a vision; I speak with him in a dream.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Not so with my servant Moses. He is faithful in all my house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With him I speak mouth to mouth, clearly, and not in riddles, and he beholds the form of the Lord. Why then were you not afraid to speak against my servant Moses?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the anger of the Lord was kindled against them, and he departed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the cloud removed from over the tent, behold, Miriam was leprous, like snow. And Aaron turned towards Miriam, and behold, she was leprous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Aaron said to Moses, “Oh, my lord, do not punish us because we have done foolishly and have sinned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let her not be as one dead, whose flesh is half eaten away when he comes out of his mother's womb.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses cried to the Lord, “O God, please heal her—please.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord said to Moses, “If her father had but spat in her face, should she not be shamed for seven days? Let her be shut outside the camp for seven days, and after that she may be brought in again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Miriam was shut outside the camp for seven days, and the people did not set out on the march till Miriam was brought in again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After that the people set out from Hazeroth, and camped in the wilderness of Paran.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Send men to spy out the land of Canaan, which I am giving to the people of Israel. From each tribe of their fathers you shall send a man, every one a chief among them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses sent them from the wilderness of Paran, according to the command of the Lord, all of them men who were heads of the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And these were their names: From the tribe of Reuben, Shammua the son of Zaccur;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the tribe of Simeon, Shaphat the son of Hori;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the tribe of Judah, Caleb the son of Jephunneh;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the tribe of Issachar, Igal the son of Joseph;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the tribe of Ephraim, Hoshea the son of Nun;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the tribe of Benjamin, Palti the son of Raphu;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the tribe of Zebulun, Gaddiel the son of Sodi;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the tribe of Joseph (that is, from the tribe of Manasseh), Gaddi the son of Susi;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the tribe of Dan, Ammiel the son of Gemalli;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the tribe of Asher, Sethur the son of Michael;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the tribe of Naphtali, Nahbi the son of Vophsi;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the tribe of Gad, Geuel the son of Machi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the names of the men whom Moses sent to spy out the land. And Moses called Hoshea the son of Nun Joshua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses sent them to spy out the land of Canaan and said to them, “Go up into the Negeb and go up into the hill country,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and see what the land is, and whether the people who dwell in it are strong or weak, whether they are few or many,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and whether the land that they dwell in is good or bad, and whether the cities that they dwell in are camps or strongholds,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and whether the land is rich or poor, and whether there are trees in it or not. Be of good courage and bring some of the fruit of the land.” Now the time was the season of the first ripe grapes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they went up and spied out the land from the wilderness of Zin to Rehob, near Lebo-hamath.
verses.speaker: Narrator
