verses.text: They went up into the Negeb and came to Hebron. Ahiman, Sheshai, and Talmai, the descendants of Anak, were there. (Hebron was built seven years before Zoan in Egypt.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they came to the Valley of Eshcol and cut down from there a branch with a single cluster of grapes, and they carried it on a pole between two of them; they also brought some pomegranates and figs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That place was called the Valley of Eshcol, because of the cluster that the people of Israel cut down from there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the end of forty days they returned from spying out the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they came to Moses and Aaron and to all the congregation of the people of Israel in the wilderness of Paran, at Kadesh. They brought back word to them and to all the congregation, and showed them the fruit of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they told him, “We came to the land to which you sent us. It flows with milk and honey, and this is its fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, the people who dwell in the land are strong, and the cities are fortified and very large. And besides, we saw the descendants of Anak there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Amalekites dwell in the land of the Negeb. The Hittites, the Jebusites, and the Amorites dwell in the hill country. And the Canaanites dwell by the sea, and along the Jordan.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Caleb quietened the people before Moses and said, “Let us go up at once and occupy it, for we are well able to overcome it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the men who had gone up with him said, “We are not able to go up against the people, for they are stronger than we are.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they brought to the people of Israel a bad report of the land that they had spied out, saying, “The land, through which we have gone to spy it out, is a land that devours its inhabitants, and all the people that we saw in it are of great height.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there we saw the Nephilim (the sons of Anak, who come from the Nephilim), and we seemed to ourselves like grasshoppers, and so we seemed to them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the congregation raised a loud cry, and the people wept that night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the people of Israel grumbled against Moses and Aaron. The whole congregation said to them, “Would that we had died in the land of Egypt! Or would that we had died in this wilderness!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why is the Lord bringing us into this land, to fall by the sword? Our wives and our little ones will become a prey. Would it not be better for us to go back to Egypt?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said to one another, “Let us choose a leader and go back to Egypt.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses and Aaron fell on their faces before all the assembly of the congregation of the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joshua the son of Nun and Caleb the son of Jephunneh, who were among those who had spied out the land, tore their clothes
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to all the congregation of the people of Israel, “The land, which we passed through to spy it out, is an exceedingly good land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the Lord delights in us, he will bring us into this land and give it to us, a land that flows with milk and honey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only do not rebel against the Lord. And do not fear the people of the land, for they are bread for us. Their protection is removed from them, and the Lord is with us; do not fear them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the congregation said to stone them with stones. But the glory of the Lord appeared at the tent of meeting to all the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to Moses, “How long will this people despise me? And how long will they not believe in me, in spite of all the signs that I have done among them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will strike them with the pestilence and disinherit them, and I will make of you a nation greater and mightier than they.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Moses said to the Lord, “Then the Egyptians will hear of it, for you brought up this people in your might from among them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they will tell the inhabitants of this land. They have heard that you, O Lord, are in the midst of this people. For you, O Lord, are seen face to face, and your cloud stands over them and you go before them, in a pillar of cloud by day and in a pillar of fire by night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now if you kill this people as one man, then the nations who have heard your fame will say,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘It is because the Lord was not able to bring this people into the land that he swore to give to them that he has killed them in the wilderness.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now, please let the power of the Lord be great as you have promised, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘The Lord is slow to anger and abounding in steadfast love, forgiving iniquity and transgression, but he will by no means clear the guilty, visiting the iniquity of the fathers on the children, to the third and the fourth generation.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Please pardon the iniquity of this people, according to the greatness of your steadfast love, just as you have forgiven this people, from Egypt until now.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said, “I have pardoned, according to your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But truly, as I live, and as all the earth shall be filled with the glory of the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: none of the men who have seen my glory and my signs that I did in Egypt and in the wilderness, and yet have put me to the test these ten times and have not obeyed my voice,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: shall see the land that I swore to give to their fathers. And none of those who despised me shall see it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But my servant Caleb, because he has a different spirit and has followed me fully, I will bring into the land into which he went, and his descendants shall possess it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, since the Amalekites and the Canaanites dwell in the valleys, turn tomorrow and set out for the wilderness by the way to the Red Sea.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “How long shall this wicked congregation grumble against me? I have heard the grumblings of the people of Israel, which they grumble against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Say to them, ‘As I live, declares the Lord, what you have said in my hearing I will do to you:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: your dead bodies shall fall in this wilderness, and of all your number, listed in the census from twenty years old and upwards, who have grumbled against me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not one shall come into the land where I swore that I would make you dwell, except Caleb the son of Jephunneh and Joshua the son of Nun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But your little ones, who you said would become a prey, I will bring in, and they shall know the land that you have rejected.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as for you, your dead bodies shall fall in this wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And your children shall be shepherds in the wilderness for forty years and shall suffer for your faithlessness, until the last of your dead bodies lies in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: According to the number of the days in which you spied out the land, forty days, a year for each day, you shall bear your iniquity for forty years, and you shall know my displeasure.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I, the Lord, have spoken. Surely this will I do to all this wicked congregation who are gathered together against me: in this wilderness they shall come to a full end, and there they shall die.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the men whom Moses sent to spy out the land, who returned and made all the congregation grumble against him by bringing up a bad report about the land—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the men who brought up a bad report of the land—died by plague before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of those men who went to spy out the land, only Joshua the son of Nun and Caleb the son of Jephunneh remained alive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Moses told these words to all the people of Israel, the people mourned greatly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they rose early in the morning and went up to the heights of the hill country, saying, “Here we are. We will go up to the place that the Lord has promised, for we have sinned.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Moses said, “Why now are you transgressing the command of the Lord, when that will not succeed?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not go up, for the Lord is not among you, lest you be struck down before your enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For there the Amalekites and the Canaanites are facing you, and you shall fall by the sword. Because you have turned back from following the Lord, the Lord will not be with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they presumed to go up to the heights of the hill country, although neither the ark of the covenant of the Lord nor Moses departed out of the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Amalekites and the Canaanites who lived in that hill country came down and defeated them and pursued them, even to Hormah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to the people of Israel and say to them, When you come into the land you are to inhabit, which I am giving you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you offer to the Lord from the herd or from the flock a food offering or a burnt offering or a sacrifice, to fulfil a vow or as a freewill offering or at your appointed feasts, to make a pleasing aroma to the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then he who brings his offering shall offer to the Lord a grain offering of a tenth of an ephah of fine flour, mixed with a quarter of a hin of oil;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you shall offer with the burnt offering, or for the sacrifice, a quarter of a hin of wine for the drink offering for each lamb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or for a ram, you shall offer for a grain offering two tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with a third of a hin of oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for the drink offering you shall offer a third of a hin of wine, a pleasing aroma to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when you offer a bull as a burnt offering or sacrifice, to fulfil a vow or for peace offerings to the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then one shall offer with the bull a grain offering of three tenths of an ephah of fine flour, mixed with half a hin of oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall offer for the drink offering half a hin of wine, as a food offering, a pleasing aroma to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus it shall be done for each bull or ram, or for each lamb or young goat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As many as you offer, so shall you do with each one, as many as there are.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every native Israelite shall do these things in this way, in offering a food offering, with a pleasing aroma to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if a stranger is sojourning with you, or anyone is living permanently among you, and he wishes to offer a food offering, with a pleasing aroma to the Lord, he shall do as you do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the assembly, there shall be one statute for you and for the stranger who sojourns with you, a statute for ever throughout your generations. You and the sojourner shall be alike before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One law and one rule shall be for you and for the stranger who sojourns with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to the people of Israel and say to them, When you come into the land to which I bring you
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when you eat of the bread of the land, you shall present a contribution to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the first of your dough you shall present a loaf as a contribution; like a contribution from the threshing floor, so shall you present it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of the first of your dough you shall give to the Lord as a contribution throughout your generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But if you sin unintentionally, and do not observe all these commandments that the Lord has spoken to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all that the Lord has commanded you by Moses, from the day that the Lord gave commandment, and onward throughout your generations,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then if it was done unintentionally without the knowledge of the congregation, all the congregation shall offer one bull from the herd for a burnt offering, a pleasing aroma to the Lord, with its grain offering and its drink offering, according to the rule, and one male goat for a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the priest shall make atonement for all the congregation of the people of Israel, and they shall be forgiven, because it was a mistake, and they have brought their offering, a food offering to the Lord, and their sin offering before the Lord for their mistake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the congregation of the people of Israel shall be forgiven, and the stranger who sojourns among them, because the whole population was involved in the mistake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If one person sins unintentionally, he shall offer a female goat a year old for a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the priest shall make atonement before the Lord for the person who makes a mistake, when he sins unintentionally, to make atonement for him, and he shall be forgiven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall have one law for him who does anything unintentionally, for him who is native among the people of Israel and for the stranger who sojourns among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the person who does anything with a high hand, whether he is native or a sojourner, reviles the Lord, and that person shall be cut off from among his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because he has despised the word of the Lord and has broken his commandment, that person shall be utterly cut off; his iniquity shall be on him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While the people of Israel were in the wilderness, they found a man gathering sticks on the Sabbath day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those who found him gathering sticks brought him to Moses and Aaron and to all the congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They put him in custody, because it had not been made clear what should be done to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to Moses, “The man shall be put to death; all the congregation shall stone him with stones outside the camp.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the congregation brought him outside the camp and stoned him to death with stones, as the Lord commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to the people of Israel, and tell them to make tassels on the corners of their garments throughout their generations, and to put a cord of blue on the tassel of each corner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall be a tassel for you to look at and remember all the commandments of the Lord, to do them, not to follow after your own heart and your own eyes, which you are inclined to whore after.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you shall remember and do all my commandments, and be holy to your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am the Lord your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt to be your God: I am the Lord your God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Korah the son of Izhar, son of Kohath, son of Levi, and Dathan and Abiram the sons of Eliab, and On the son of Peleth, sons of Reuben, took men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they rose up before Moses, with a number of the people of Israel, 250 chiefs of the congregation, chosen from the assembly, well-known men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They assembled themselves together against Moses and against Aaron and said to them, “You have gone too far! For all in the congregation are holy, every one of them, and the Lord is among them. Why then do you exalt yourselves above the assembly of the Lord?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Moses heard it, he fell on his face,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said to Korah and all his company, “In the morning the Lord will show who is his, and who is holy, and will bring him near to him. The one whom he chooses he will bring near to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do this: take censers, Korah and all his company;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: put fire in them and put incense on them before the Lord tomorrow, and the man whom the Lord chooses shall be the holy one. You have gone too far, sons of Levi!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said to Korah, “Hear now, you sons of Levi:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: is it too small a thing for you that the God of Israel has separated you from the congregation of Israel, to bring you near to himself, to do service in the tabernacle of the Lord and to stand before the congregation to minister to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that he has brought you near him, and all your brothers the sons of Levi with you? And would you seek the priesthood also?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore it is against the Lord that you and all your company have gathered together. What is Aaron that you grumble against him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses sent to call Dathan and Abiram the sons of Eliab, and they said, “We will not come up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is it a small thing that you have brought us up out of a land flowing with milk and honey, to kill us in the wilderness, that you must also make yourself a prince over us?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, you have not brought us into a land flowing with milk and honey, nor given us inheritance of fields and vineyards. Will you put out the eyes of these men? We will not come up.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses was very angry and said to the Lord, “Do not respect their offering. I have not taken one donkey from them, and I have not harmed one of them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said to Korah, “Be present, you and all your company, before the Lord, you and they, and Aaron, tomorrow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And let every one of you take his censer and put incense on it, and every one of you bring before the Lord his censer, 250 censers; you also, and Aaron, each his censer.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So every man took his censer and put fire in them and laid incense on them and stood at the entrance of the tent of meeting with Moses and Aaron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Korah assembled all the congregation against them at the entrance of the tent of meeting. And the glory of the Lord appeared to all the congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Separate yourselves from among this congregation, that I may consume them in a moment.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they fell on their faces and said, “O God, the God of the spirits of all flesh, shall one man sin, and will you be angry with all the congregation?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Say to the congregation, Get away from the dwelling of Korah, Dathan, and Abiram.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses rose and went to Dathan and Abiram, and the elders of Israel followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he spoke to the congregation, saying, “Depart, please, from the tents of these wicked men, and touch nothing of theirs, lest you be swept away with all their sins.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they got away from the dwelling of Korah, Dathan, and Abiram. And Dathan and Abiram came out and stood at the door of their tents, together with their wives, their sons, and their little ones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said, “Hereby you shall know that the Lord has sent me to do all these works, and that it has not been of my own accord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If these men die as all men die, or if they are visited by the fate of all mankind, then the Lord has not sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the Lord creates something new, and the ground opens its mouth and swallows them up with all that belongs to them, and they go down alive into Sheol, then you shall know that these men have despised the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as soon as he had finished speaking all these words, the ground under them split apart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the earth opened its mouth and swallowed them up, with their households and all the people who belonged to Korah and all their goods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they and all that belonged to them went down alive into Sheol, and the earth closed over them, and they perished from the midst of the assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all Israel who were around them fled at their cry, for they said, “Lest the earth swallow us up!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And fire came out from the Lord and consumed the 250 men offering the incense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Tell Eleazar the son of Aaron the priest to take up the censers out of the blaze. Then scatter the fire far and wide, for they have become holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the censers of these men who have sinned at the cost of their lives, let them be made into hammered plates as a covering for the altar, for they offered them before the Lord, and they became holy. Thus they shall be a sign to the people of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Eleazar the priest took the bronze censers, which those who were burned had offered, and they were hammered out as a covering for the altar,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to be a reminder to the people of Israel, so that no outsider, who is not of the descendants of Aaron, should draw near to burn incense before the Lord, lest he become like Korah and his company—as the Lord said to him through Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But on the next day all the congregation of the people of Israel grumbled against Moses and against Aaron, saying, “You have killed the people of the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the congregation had assembled against Moses and against Aaron, they turned towards the tent of meeting. And behold, the cloud covered it, and the glory of the Lord appeared.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses and Aaron came to the front of the tent of meeting,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Get away from the midst of this congregation, that I may consume them in a moment.” And they fell on their faces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said to Aaron, “Take your censer, and put fire on it from the altar and lay incense on it and carry it quickly to the congregation and make atonement for them, for wrath has gone out from the Lord; the plague has begun.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Aaron took it as Moses said and ran into the midst of the assembly. And behold, the plague had already begun among the people. And he put on the incense and made atonement for the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he stood between the dead and the living, and the plague was stopped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now those who died in the plague were 14,700, besides those who died in the affair of Korah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Aaron returned to Moses at the entrance of the tent of meeting, when the plague was stopped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to the people of Israel, and get from them staffs, one for each fathers' house, from all their chiefs according to their fathers' houses, twelve staffs. Write each man's name on his staff,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and write Aaron's name on the staff of Levi. For there shall be one staff for the head of each fathers' house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you shall deposit them in the tent of meeting before the testimony, where I meet with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the staff of the man whom I choose shall sprout. Thus I will make to cease from me the grumblings of the people of Israel, which they grumble against you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses spoke to the people of Israel. And all their chiefs gave him staffs, one for each chief, according to their fathers' houses, twelve staffs. And the staff of Aaron was among their staffs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses deposited the staffs before the Lord in the tent of the testimony.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the next day Moses went into the tent of the testimony, and behold, the staff of Aaron for the house of Levi had sprouted and put forth buds and produced blossoms, and it bore ripe almonds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses brought out all the staffs from before the Lord to all the people of Israel. And they looked, and each man took his staff.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to Moses, “Put back the staff of Aaron before the testimony, to be kept as a sign for the rebels, that you may make an end of their grumblings against me, lest they die.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus did Moses; as the Lord commanded him, so he did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people of Israel said to Moses, “Behold, we perish, we are undone, we are all undone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone who comes near, who comes near to the tabernacle of the Lord, shall die. Are we all to perish?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord said to Aaron, “You and your sons and your father's house with you shall bear iniquity connected with the sanctuary, and you and your sons with you shall bear iniquity connected with your priesthood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And with you bring your brothers also, the tribe of Levi, the tribe of your father, that they may join you and minister to you while you and your sons with you are before the tent of the testimony.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall keep guard over you and over the whole tent, but shall not come near to the vessels of the sanctuary or to the altar lest they, and you, die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall join you and keep guard over the tent of meeting for all the service of the tent, and no outsider shall come near you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall keep guard over the sanctuary and over the altar, that there may never again be wrath on the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, I have taken your brothers the Levites from among the people of Israel. They are a gift to you, given to the Lord, to do the service of the tent of meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you and your sons with you shall guard your priesthood for all that concerns the altar and that is within the veil; and you shall serve. I give your priesthood as a gift, and any outsider who comes near shall be put to death.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to Aaron, “Behold, I have given you charge of the contributions made to me, all the consecrated things of the people of Israel. I have given them to you as a portion and to your sons as a perpetual due.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This shall be yours of the most holy things, reserved from the fire: every offering of theirs, every grain offering of theirs and every sin offering of theirs and every guilt offering of theirs, which they render to me, shall be most holy to you and to your sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In a most holy place shall you eat it. Every male may eat it; it is holy to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This also is yours: the contribution of their gift, all the wave offerings of the people of Israel. I have given them to you, and to your sons and daughters with you, as a perpetual due. Everyone who is clean in your house may eat it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the best of the oil and all the best of the wine and of the grain, the firstfruits of what they give to the Lord, I give to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The first ripe fruits of all that is in their land, which they bring to the Lord, shall be yours. Everyone who is clean in your house may eat it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every devoted thing in Israel shall be yours.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everything that opens the womb of all flesh, whether man or beast, which they offer to the Lord, shall be yours. Nevertheless, the firstborn of man you shall redeem, and the firstborn of unclean animals you shall redeem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And their redemption price (at a month old you shall redeem them) you shall fix at five shekels in silver, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, which is twenty gerahs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the firstborn of a cow, or the firstborn of a sheep, or the firstborn of a goat, you shall not redeem; they are holy. You shall sprinkle their blood on the altar and shall burn their fat as a food offering, with a pleasing aroma to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But their flesh shall be yours, as the breast that is waved and as the right thigh are yours.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the holy contributions that the people of Israel present to the Lord I give to you, and to your sons and daughters with you, as a perpetual due. It is a covenant of salt for ever before the Lord for you and for your offspring with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to Aaron, “You shall have no inheritance in their land, neither shall you have any portion among them. I am your portion and your inheritance among the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “To the Levites I have given every tithe in Israel for an inheritance, in return for their service that they do, their service in the tent of meeting,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that the people of Israel do not come near the tent of meeting, lest they bear sin and die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Levites shall do the service of the tent of meeting, and they shall bear their iniquity. It shall be a perpetual statute throughout your generations, and among the people of Israel they shall have no inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the tithe of the people of Israel, which they present as a contribution to the Lord, I have given to the Levites for an inheritance. Therefore I have said of them that they shall have no inheritance among the people of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Moreover, you shall speak and say to the Levites, ‘When you take from the people of Israel the tithe that I have given you from them for your inheritance, then you shall present a contribution from it to the Lord, a tithe of the tithe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And your contribution shall be counted to you as though it were the grain of the threshing floor, and as the fullness of the wine press.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you shall also present a contribution to the Lord from all your tithes, which you receive from the people of Israel. And from it you shall give the Lord's contribution to Aaron the priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Out of all the gifts to you, you shall present every contribution due to the Lord; from each its best part is to be dedicated.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore you shall say to them, ‘When you have offered from it the best of it, then the rest shall be counted to the Levites as produce of the threshing floor, and as produce of the wine press.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you may eat it in any place, you and your households, for it is your reward in return for your service in the tent of meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall bear no sin by reason of it, when you have contributed the best of it. But you shall not profane the holy things of the people of Israel, lest you die.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Lord spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is the statute of the law that the Lord has commanded: Tell the people of Israel to bring you a red heifer without defect, in which there is no blemish, and on which a yoke has never come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall give it to Eleazar the priest, and it shall be taken outside the camp and slaughtered before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Eleazar the priest shall take some of its blood with his finger, and sprinkle some of its blood towards the front of the tent of meeting seven times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the heifer shall be burned in his sight. Its skin, its flesh, and its blood, with its dung, shall be burned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the priest shall take cedarwood and hyssop and scarlet yarn, and throw them into the fire burning the heifer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the priest shall wash his clothes and bathe his body in water, and afterwards he may come into the camp. But the priest shall be unclean until evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who burns the heifer shall wash his clothes in water and bathe his body in water and shall be unclean until evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a man who is clean shall gather up the ashes of the heifer and deposit them outside the camp in a clean place. And they shall be kept for the water for impurity for the congregation of the people of Israel; it is a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the one who gathers the ashes of the heifer shall wash his clothes and be unclean until evening. And this shall be a perpetual statute for the people of Israel, and for the stranger who sojourns among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whoever touches the dead body of any person shall be unclean for seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall cleanse himself with the water on the third day and on the seventh day, and so be clean. But if he does not cleanse himself on the third day and on the seventh day, he will not become clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever touches a dead person, the body of anyone who has died, and does not cleanse himself, defiles the tabernacle of the Lord, and that person shall be cut off from Israel; because the water for impurity was not thrown on him, he shall be unclean. His uncleanness is still on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is the law when someone dies in a tent: everyone who comes into the tent and everyone who is in the tent shall be unclean for seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And every open vessel that has no cover fastened on it is unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever in the open field touches someone who was killed with a sword or who died naturally, or touches a human bone or a grave, shall be unclean seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the unclean they shall take some ashes of the burnt sin offering, and fresh water shall be added in a vessel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a clean person shall take hyssop and dip it in the water and sprinkle it on the tent and on all the furnishings and on the persons who were there and on whoever touched the bone, or the slain or the dead or the grave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the clean person shall sprinkle it on the unclean on the third day and on the seventh day. Thus on the seventh day he shall cleanse him, and he shall wash his clothes and bathe himself in water, and at evening he shall be clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If the man who is unclean does not cleanse himself, that person shall be cut off from the midst of the assembly, since he has defiled the sanctuary of the Lord. Because the water for impurity has not been thrown on him, he is unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall be a statute for ever for them. The one who sprinkles the water for impurity shall wash his clothes, and the one who touches the water for impurity shall be unclean until evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whatever the unclean person touches shall be unclean, and anyone who touches it shall be unclean until evening.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people of Israel, the whole congregation, came into the wilderness of Zin in the first month, and the people stayed in Kadesh. And Miriam died there and was buried there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there was no water for the congregation. And they assembled themselves together against Moses and against Aaron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people quarrelled with Moses and said, “Would that we had perished when our brothers perished before the Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why have you brought the assembly of the Lord into this wilderness, that we should die here, both we and our cattle?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And why have you made us come up out of Egypt to bring us to this evil place? It is no place for grain or figs or vines or pomegranates, and there is no water to drink.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses and Aaron went from the presence of the assembly to the entrance of the tent of meeting and fell on their faces. And the glory of the Lord appeared to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take the staff, and assemble the congregation, you and Aaron your brother, and tell the rock before their eyes to yield its water. So you shall bring water out of the rock for them and give drink to the congregation and their cattle.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses took the staff from before the Lord, as he commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses and Aaron gathered the assembly together before the rock, and he said to them, “Hear now, you rebels: shall we bring water for you out of this rock?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses lifted up his hand and struck the rock with his staff twice, and water came out abundantly, and the congregation drank, and their livestock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to Moses and Aaron, “Because you did not believe in me, to uphold me as holy in the eyes of the people of Israel, therefore you shall not bring this assembly into the land that I have given them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the waters of Meribah, where the people of Israel quarrelled with the Lord, and through them he showed himself holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses sent messengers from Kadesh to the king of Edom: “Thus says your brother Israel: You know all the hardship that we have met:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: how our fathers went down to Egypt, and we lived in Egypt for a long time. And the Egyptians dealt harshly with us and our fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when we cried to the Lord, he heard our voice and sent an angel and brought us out of Egypt. And here we are in Kadesh, a city on the edge of your territory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Please let us pass through your land. We will not pass through field or vineyard, or drink water from a well. We will go along the King's Highway. We will not turn aside to the right hand or to the left until we have passed through your territory.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Edom said to him, “You shall not pass through, lest I come out with the sword against you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people of Israel said to him, “We will go up by the highway, and if we drink of your water, I and my livestock, then I will pay for it. Let me only pass through on foot, nothing more.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said, “You shall not pass through.” And Edom came out against them with a large army and with a strong force.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus Edom refused to give Israel passage through his territory, so Israel turned away from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they journeyed from Kadesh, and the people of Israel, the whole congregation, came to Mount Hor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to Moses and Aaron at Mount Hor, on the border of the land of Edom,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Let Aaron be gathered to his people, for he shall not enter the land that I have given to the people of Israel, because you rebelled against my command at the waters of Meribah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take Aaron and Eleazar his son and bring them up to Mount Hor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And strip Aaron of his garments and put them on Eleazar his son. And Aaron shall be gathered to his people and shall die there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses did as the Lord commanded. And they went up Mount Hor in the sight of all the congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses stripped Aaron of his garments and put them on Eleazar his son. And Aaron died there on the top of the mountain. Then Moses and Eleazar came down from the mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when all the congregation saw that Aaron had perished, all the house of Israel wept for Aaron for thirty days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Canaanite, the king of Arad, who lived in the Negeb, heard that Israel was coming by the way of Atharim, he fought against Israel, and took some of them captive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Israel vowed a vow to the Lord and said, “If you will indeed give this people into my hand, then I will devote their cities to destruction.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord heeded the voice of Israel and gave over the Canaanites, and they devoted them and their cities to destruction. So the name of the place was called Hormah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Mount Hor they set out by the way to the Red Sea, to go round the land of Edom. And the people became impatient on the way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people spoke against God and against Moses, “Why have you brought us up out of Egypt to die in the wilderness? For there is no food and no water, and we loathe this worthless food.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord sent fiery serpents among the people, and they bit the people, so that many people of Israel died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people came to Moses and said, “We have sinned, for we have spoken against the Lord and against you. Pray to the Lord, that he take away the serpents from us.” So Moses prayed for the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to Moses, “Make a fiery serpent and set it on a pole, and everyone who is bitten, when he sees it, shall live.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses made a bronze serpent and set it on a pole. And if a serpent bit anyone, he would look at the bronze serpent and live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people of Israel set out and camped in Oboth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they set out from Oboth and camped at Iye-abarim, in the wilderness that is opposite Moab, towards the sunrise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From there they set out and camped in the Valley of Zered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From there they set out and camped on the other side of the Arnon, which is in the wilderness that extends from the border of the Amorites, for the Arnon is the border of Moab, between Moab and the Amorites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore it is said in the Book of the Wars of the Lord,
“Waheb in Suphah, and the valleys of the Arnon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and the slope of the valleys
that extends to the seat of Ar,
and leans to the border of Moab.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And from there they continued to Beer; that is the well of which the Lord said to Moses, “Gather the people together, so that I may give them water.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Israel sang this song:
“Spring up, O well!—Sing to it!—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the well that the princes made,
that the nobles of the people dug,
with the sceptre and with their staffs.”
And from the wilderness they went on to Mattanah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and from Mattanah to Nahaliel, and from Nahaliel to Bamoth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and from Bamoth to the valley lying in the region of Moab by the top of Pisgah that looks down on the desert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Israel sent messengers to Sihon king of the Amorites, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Let me pass through your land. We will not turn aside into field or vineyard. We will not drink the water of a well. We will go by the King's Highway until we have passed through your territory.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Sihon would not allow Israel to pass through his territory. He gathered all his people together and went out against Israel to the wilderness and came to Jahaz and fought against Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Israel defeated him with the edge of the sword and took possession of his land from the Arnon to the Jabbok, as far as to the Ammonites, for the border of the Ammonites was strong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Israel took all these cities, and Israel settled in all the cities of the Amorites, in Heshbon, and in all its villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Heshbon was the city of Sihon the king of the Amorites, who had fought against the former king of Moab and taken all his land out of his hand, as far as the Arnon.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For fire came out from Heshbon,
    flame from the city of Sihon.
It devoured Ar of Moab,
    and swallowed the heights of the Arnon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Woe to you, O Moab!
    You are undone, O people of Chemosh!
He has made his sons fugitives,
    and his daughters captives,
    to an Amorite king, Sihon.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: Thus Israel lived in the land of the Amorites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses sent to spy out Jazer, and they captured its villages and dispossessed the Amorites who were there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they turned and went up by the way to Bashan. And Og the king of Bashan came out against them, he and all his people, to battle at Edrei.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord said to Moses, “Do not fear him, for I have given him into your hand, and all his people, and his land. And you shall do to him as you did to Sihon king of the Amorites, who lived at Heshbon.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they defeated him and his sons and all his people, until he had no survivor left. And they possessed his land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the people of Israel set out and camped in the plains of Moab beyond the Jordan at Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balak the son of Zippor saw all that Israel had done to the Amorites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moab was in great dread of the people, because they were many. Moab was overcome with fear of the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moab said to the elders of Midian, “This horde will now lick up all that is around us, as the ox licks up the grass of the field.” So Balak the son of Zippor, who was king of Moab at that time,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: sent messengers to Balaam the son of Beor at Pethor, which is near the River in the land of the people of Amaw, to call him, saying, “Behold, a people has come out of Egypt. They cover the face of the earth, and they are dwelling opposite me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Come now, curse this people for me, since they are too mighty for me. Perhaps I shall be able to defeat them and drive them from the land, for I know that he whom you bless is blessed, and he whom you curse is cursed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the elders of Moab and the elders of Midian departed with the fees for divination in their hand. And they came to Balaam and gave him Balak's message.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Lodge here tonight, and I will bring back word to you, as the Lord speaks to me.” So the princes of Moab stayed with Balaam.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God came to Balaam and said, “Who are these men with you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balaam said to God, “Balak the son of Zippor, king of Moab, has sent to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Behold, a people has come out of Egypt, and it covers the face of the earth. Now come, curse them for me. Perhaps I shall be able to fight against them and drive them out.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God said to Balaam, “You shall not go with them. You shall not curse the people, for they are blessed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Balaam rose in the morning and said to the princes of Balak, “Go to your own land, for the Lord has refused to let me go with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the princes of Moab rose and went to Balak and said, “Balaam refuses to come with us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Once again Balak sent princes, more in number and more honourable than these.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they came to Balaam and said to him, “Thus says Balak the son of Zippor: ‘Let nothing hinder you from coming to me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I will surely do you great honour, and whatever you say to me I will do. Come, curse this people for me.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Balaam answered and said to the servants of Balak, “Though Balak were to give me his house full of silver and gold, I could not go beyond the command of the Lord my God to do less or more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you, too, please stay here tonight, that I may know what more the Lord will say to me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God came to Balaam at night and said to him, “If the men have come to call you, rise, go with them; but only do what I tell you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Balaam rose in the morning and saddled his donkey and went with the princes of Moab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God's anger was kindled because he went, and the angel of the Lord took his stand in the way as his adversary. Now he was riding on the donkey, and his two servants were with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the donkey saw the angel of the Lord standing in the road, with a drawn sword in his hand. And the donkey turned aside out of the road and went into the field. And Balaam struck the donkey, to turn her into the road.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the angel of the Lord stood in a narrow path between the vineyards, with a wall on either side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the donkey saw the angel of the Lord, she pushed against the wall and pressed Balaam's foot against the wall. So he struck her again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the angel of the Lord went ahead and stood in a narrow place, where there was no way to turn either to the right or to the left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the donkey saw the angel of the Lord, she lay down under Balaam. And Balaam's anger was kindled, and he struck the donkey with his staff.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord opened the mouth of the donkey, and she said to Balaam, “What have I done to you, that you have struck me these three times?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balaam said to the donkey, “Because you have made a fool of me. I wish I had a sword in my hand, for then I would kill you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the donkey said to Balaam, “Am I not your donkey, on which you have ridden all your life long to this day? Is it my habit to treat you this way?” And he said, “No.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord opened the eyes of Balaam, and he saw the angel of the Lord standing in the way, with his drawn sword in his hand. And he bowed down and fell on his face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the angel of the Lord said to him, “Why have you struck your donkey these three times? Behold, I have come out to oppose you because your way is perverse before me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The donkey saw me and turned aside before me these three times. If she had not turned aside from me, surely just now I would have killed you and let her live.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Balaam said to the angel of the Lord, “I have sinned, for I did not know that you stood in the road against me. Now therefore, if it is evil in your sight, I will turn back.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the angel of the Lord said to Balaam, “Go with the men, but speak only the word that I tell you.” So Balaam went on with the princes of Balak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Balak heard that Balaam had come, he went out to meet him at the city of Moab, on the border formed by the Arnon, at the extremity of the border.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balak said to Balaam, “Did I not send to you to call you? Why did you not come to me? Am I not able to honour you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Balaam said to Balak, “Behold, I have come to you! Have I now any power of my own to speak anything? The word that God puts in my mouth, that must I speak.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Balaam went with Balak, and they came to Kiriath-huzoth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balak sacrificed oxen and sheep, and sent for Balaam and for the princes who were with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the morning Balak took Balaam and brought him up to Bamoth-baal, and from there he saw a fraction of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balaam said to Balak, “Build for me here seven altars, and prepare for me here seven bulls and seven rams.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Balak did as Balaam had said. And Balak and Balaam offered on each altar a bull and a ram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balaam said to Balak, “Stand beside your burnt offering, and I will go. Perhaps the Lord will come to meet me, and whatever he shows me I will tell you.” And he went to a bare height,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and God met Balaam. And Balaam said to him, “I have arranged the seven altars and I have offered on each altar a bull and a ram.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord put a word in Balaam's mouth and said, “Return to Balak, and thus you shall speak.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he returned to him, and behold, he and all the princes of Moab were standing beside his burnt offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And Balaam took up his discourse and said,
“From Aram Balak has brought me,
    the king of Moab from the eastern mountains:
‘Come, curse Jacob for me,
    and come, denounce Israel!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How can I curse whom God has not cursed?
    How can I denounce whom the Lord has not denounced?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For from the top of the crags I see him,
    from the hills I behold him;
behold, a people dwelling alone,
    and not counting itself among the nations!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who can count the dust of Jacob
    or number the fourth part of Israel?
Let me die the death of the upright,
    and let my end be like his!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balak said to Balaam, “What have you done to me? I took you to curse my enemies, and behold, you have done nothing but bless them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he answered and said, “Must I not take care to speak what the Lord puts in my mouth?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balak said to him, “Please come with me to another place, from which you may see them. You shall see only a fraction of them and shall not see them all. Then curse them for me from there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he took him to the field of Zophim, to the top of Pisgah, and built seven altars and offered a bull and a ram on each altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Balaam said to Balak, “Stand here beside your burnt offering, while I meet the Lord over there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord met Balaam and put a word in his mouth and said, “Return to Balak, and thus shall you speak.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he came to him, and behold, he was standing beside his burnt offering, and the princes of Moab with him. And Balak said to him, “What has the Lord spoken?”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
God is not man, that he should lie,
    or a son of man, that he should change his mind.
Has he said, and will he not do it?
    Or has he spoken, and will he not fulfil it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, I received a command to bless:
    he has blessed, and I cannot revoke it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has not beheld misfortune in Jacob,
    nor has he seen trouble in Israel.
The Lord their God is with them,
    and the shout of a king is among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God brings them out of Egypt
    and is for them like the horns of the wild ox.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For there is no enchantment against Jacob,
    no divination against Israel;
now it shall be said of Jacob and Israel,
    ‘What has God wrought!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, a people! As a lioness it rises up
    and as a lion it lifts itself;
it does not lie down until it has devoured the prey
    and drunk the blood of the slain.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balak said to Balaam, “Do not curse them at all, and do not bless them at all.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Balaam answered Balak, “Did I not tell you, ‘All that the Lord says, that I must do’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balak said to Balaam, “Come now, I will take you to another place. Perhaps it will please God that you may curse them for me from there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Balak took Balaam to the top of Peor, which overlooks the desert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balaam said to Balak, “Build for me here seven altars and prepare for me here seven bulls and seven rams.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balak did as Balaam had said, and offered a bull and a ram on each altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Balaam saw that it pleased the Lord to bless Israel, he did not go, as at other times, to look for omens, but set his face towards the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balaam lifted up his eyes and saw Israel camping tribe by tribe. And the Spirit of God came upon him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and he took up his discourse and said,
“The oracle of Balaam the son of Beor,
    the oracle of the man whose eye is opened,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the oracle of him who hears the words of God,
    who sees the vision of the Almighty,
    falling down with his eyes uncovered:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How lovely are your tents, O Jacob,
    your encampments, O Israel!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like palm groves that stretch afar,
    like gardens beside a river,
like aloes that the Lord has planted,
    like cedar trees beside the waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Water shall flow from his buckets,
    and his seed shall be in many waters;
his king shall be higher than Agag,
    and his kingdom shall be exalted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God brings him out of Egypt
    and is for him like the horns of the wild ox;
he shall eat up the nations, his adversaries,
    and shall break their bones in pieces
    and pierce them through with his arrows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He crouched, he lay down like a lion
    and like a lioness; who will rouse him up?
Blessed are those who bless you,
    and cursed are those who curse you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balak's anger was kindled against Balaam, and he struck his hands together. And Balak said to Balaam, “I called you to curse my enemies, and behold, you have blessed them these three times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore now flee to your own place. I said, ‘I will certainly honour you’, but the Lord has held you back from honour.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balaam said to Balak, “Did I not tell your messengers whom you sent to me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘If Balak should give me his house full of silver and gold, I would not be able to go beyond the word of the Lord, to do either good or bad of my own will. What the Lord speaks, that will I speak’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now, behold, I am going to my people. Come, I will let you know what this people will do to your people in the latter days.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he took up his discourse and said,
“The oracle of Balaam the son of Beor,
    the oracle of the man whose eye is opened,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the oracle of him who hears the words of God,
    and knows the knowledge of the Most High,
who sees the vision of the Almighty,
    falling down with his eyes uncovered:
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
And one from Jacob shall exercise dominion
    and destroy the survivors of cities!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he looked on Amalek and took up his discourse and said,
“Amalek was the first among the nations,
    but its end is utter destruction.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he looked on the Kenite, and took up his discourse and said,
“Enduring is your dwelling place,
    and your nest is set in the rock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Nevertheless, Kain shall be burned
    when Asshur takes you away captive.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he took up his discourse and said,
“Alas, who shall live when God does this?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: Then Balaam rose and went back to his place. And Balak also went his way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Israel lived in Shittim, the people began to whore with the daughters of Moab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These invited the people to the sacrifices of their gods, and the people ate and bowed down to their gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Israel yoked himself to Baal of Peor. And the anger of the Lord was kindled against Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to Moses, “Take all the chiefs of the people and hang them in the sun before the Lord, that the fierce anger of the Lord may turn away from Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said to the judges of Israel, “Each of you kill those of his men who have yoked themselves to Baal of Peor.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, one of the people of Israel came and brought a Midianite woman to his family, in the sight of Moses and in the sight of the whole congregation of the people of Israel, while they were weeping in the entrance of the tent of meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Phinehas the son of Eleazar, son of Aaron the priest, saw it, he rose and left the congregation and took a spear in his hand
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and went after the man of Israel into the chamber and pierced both of them, the man of Israel and the woman through her belly. Thus the plague on the people of Israel was stopped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, those who died by the plague were twenty-four thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Phinehas the son of Eleazar, son of Aaron the priest, has turned back my wrath from the people of Israel, in that he was jealous with my jealousy among them, so that I did not consume the people of Israel in my jealousy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore say, ‘Behold, I give to him my covenant of peace,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it shall be to him and to his descendants after him the covenant of a perpetual priesthood, because he was jealous for his God and made atonement for the people of Israel.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The name of the slain man of Israel, who was killed with the Midianite woman, was Zimri the son of Salu, chief of a father's house belonging to the Simeonites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the name of the Midianite woman who was killed was Cozbi the daughter of Zur, who was the tribal head of a father's house in Midian.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Harass the Midianites and strike them down,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for they have harassed you with their wiles, with which they beguiled you in the matter of Peor, and in the matter of Cozbi, the daughter of the chief of Midian, their sister, who was killed on the day of the plague on account of Peor.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After the plague, the Lord said to Moses and to Eleazar the son of Aaron, the priest,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take a census of all the congregation of the people of Israel, from twenty years old and upwards, by their fathers' houses, all in Israel who are able to go to war.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses and Eleazar the priest spoke with them in the plains of Moab by the Jordan at Jericho, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take a census of the people, from twenty years old and upwards”, as the Lord commanded Moses. The people of Israel who came out of the land of Egypt were:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Reuben, the firstborn of Israel; the sons of Reuben: of Hanoch, the clan of the Hanochites; of Pallu, the clan of the Palluites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of Hezron, the clan of the Hezronites; of Carmi, the clan of the Carmites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the clans of the Reubenites, and those listed were 43,730.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Pallu: Eliab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Eliab: Nemuel, Dathan, and Abiram. These are the Dathan and Abiram, chosen from the congregation, who contended against Moses and Aaron in the company of Korah, when they contended against the Lord
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the earth opened its mouth and swallowed them up together with Korah, when that company died, when the fire devoured 250 men, and they became a warning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the sons of Korah did not die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Simeon according to their clans: of Nemuel, the clan of the Nemuelites; of Jamin, the clan of the Jaminites; of Jachin, the clan of the Jachinites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of Zerah, the clan of the Zerahites; of Shaul, the clan of the Shaulites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the clans of the Simeonites, 22,200.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Gad according to their clans: of Zephon, the clan of the Zephonites; of Haggi, the clan of the Haggites; of Shuni, the clan of the Shunites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of Ozni, the clan of the Oznites; of Eri, the clan of the Erites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of Arod, the clan of the Arodites; of Areli, the clan of the Arelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the clans of the sons of Gad as they were listed, 40,500.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Judah were Er and Onan; and Er and Onan died in the land of Canaan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Judah according to their clans were: of Shelah, the clan of the Shelanites; of Perez, the clan of the Perezites; of Zerah, the clan of the Zerahites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Perez were: of Hezron, the clan of the Hezronites; of Hamul, the clan of the Hamulites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the clans of Judah as they were listed, 76,500.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Issachar according to their clans: of Tola, the clan of the Tolaites; of Puvah, the clan of the Punites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of Jashub, the clan of the Jashubites; of Shimron, the clan of the Shimronites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the clans of Issachar as they were listed, 64,300.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Zebulun, according to their clans: of Sered, the clan of the Seredites; of Elon, the clan of the Elonites; of Jahleel, the clan of the Jahleelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the clans of the Zebulunites as they were listed, 60,500.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Joseph according to their clans: Manasseh and Ephraim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Manasseh: of Machir, the clan of the Machirites; and Machir was the father of Gilead; of Gilead, the clan of the Gileadites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Gilead: of Iezer, the clan of the Iezerites; of Helek, the clan of the Helekites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and of Asriel, the clan of the Asrielites; and of Shechem, the clan of the Shechemites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and of Shemida, the clan of the Shemidaites; and of Hepher, the clan of the Hepherites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Zelophehad the son of Hepher had no sons, but daughters. And the names of the daughters of Zelophehad were Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the clans of Manasseh, and those listed were 52,700.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Ephraim according to their clans: of Shuthelah, the clan of the Shuthelahites; of Becher, the clan of the Becherites; of Tahan, the clan of the Tahanites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And these are the sons of Shuthelah: of Eran, the clan of the Eranites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the clans of the sons of Ephraim as they were listed, 32,500. These are the sons of Joseph according to their clans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Benjamin according to their clans: of Bela, the clan of the Belaites; of Ashbel, the clan of the Ashbelites; of Ahiram, the clan of the Ahiramites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of Shephupham, the clan of the Shuphamites; of Hupham, the clan of the Huphamites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Bela were Ard and Naaman: of Ard, the clan of the Ardites; of Naaman, the clan of the Naamites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Benjamin according to their clans, and those listed were 45,600.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Dan according to their clans: of Shuham, the clan of the Shuhamites. These are the clans of Dan according to their clans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the clans of the Shuhamites, as they were listed, were 64,400.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Asher according to their clans: of Imnah, the clan of the Imnites; of Ishvi, the clan of the Ishvites; of Beriah, the clan of the Beriites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the sons of Beriah: of Heber, the clan of the Heberites; of Malchiel, the clan of the Malchielites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the name of the daughter of Asher was Serah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the clans of the sons of Asher as they were listed, 53,400.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Naphtali according to their clans: of Jahzeel, the clan of the Jahzeelites; of Guni, the clan of the Gunites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of Jezer, the clan of the Jezerites; of Shillem, the clan of the Shillemites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the clans of Naphtali according to their clans, and those listed were 45,400.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was the list of the people of Israel, 601,730.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Among these the land shall be divided for inheritance according to the number of names.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To a large tribe you shall give a large inheritance, and to a small tribe you shall give a small inheritance; every tribe shall be given its inheritance in proportion to its list.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the land shall be divided by lot. According to the names of the tribes of their fathers they shall inherit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their inheritance shall be divided according to lot between the larger and the smaller.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was the list of the Levites according to their clans: of Gershon, the clan of the Gershonites; of Kohath, the clan of the Kohathites; of Merari, the clan of the Merarites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the clans of Levi: the clan of the Libnites, the clan of the Hebronites, the clan of the Mahlites, the clan of the Mushites, the clan of the Korahites. And Kohath was the father of Amram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The name of Amram's wife was Jochebed the daughter of Levi, who was born to Levi in Egypt. And she bore to Amram Aaron and Moses and Miriam their sister.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And to Aaron were born Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Nadab and Abihu died when they offered unauthorized fire before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those listed were 23,000, every male from a month old and upwards. For they were not listed among the people of Israel, because there was no inheritance given to them among the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were those listed by Moses and Eleazar the priest, who listed the people of Israel in the plains of Moab by the Jordan at Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But among these there was not one of those listed by Moses and Aaron the priest, who had listed the people of Israel in the wilderness of Sinai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord had said of them, “They shall die in the wilderness.” Not one of them was left, except Caleb the son of Jephunneh and Joshua the son of Nun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then drew near the daughters of Zelophehad the son of Hepher, son of Gilead, son of Machir, son of Manasseh, from the clans of Manasseh the son of Joseph. The names of his daughters were: Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they stood before Moses and before Eleazar the priest and before the chiefs and all the congregation, at the entrance of the tent of meeting, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Our father died in the wilderness. He was not among the company of those who gathered themselves together against the Lord in the company of Korah, but died for his own sin. And he had no sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why should the name of our father be taken away from his clan because he had no son? Give to us a possession among our father's brothers.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses brought their case before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The daughters of Zelophehad are right. You shall give them possession of an inheritance among their father's brothers and transfer the inheritance of their father to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall speak to the people of Israel, saying, ‘If a man dies and has no son, then you shall transfer his inheritance to his daughter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if he has no daughter, then you shall give his inheritance to his brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if he has no brothers, then you shall give his inheritance to his father's brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if his father has no brothers, then you shall give his inheritance to the nearest kinsman of his clan, and he shall possess it. And it shall be for the people of Israel a statute and rule, as the Lord commanded Moses.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses, “Go up into this mountain of Abarim and see the land that I have given to the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator
