verses.text: When you have seen it, you also shall be gathered to your people, as your brother Aaron was,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because you rebelled against my word in the wilderness of Zin when the congregation quarrelled, failing to uphold me as holy at the waters before their eyes.” (These are the waters of Meribah of Kadesh in the wilderness of Zin.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses spoke to the Lord, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Let the Lord, the God of the spirits of all flesh, appoint a man over the congregation
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who shall go out before them and come in before them, who shall lead them out and bring them in, that the congregation of the Lord may not be as sheep that have no shepherd.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord said to Moses, “Take Joshua the son of Nun, a man in whom is the Spirit, and lay your hand on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Make him stand before Eleazar the priest and all the congregation, and you shall commission him in their sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall invest him with some of your authority, that all the congregation of the people of Israel may obey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he shall stand before Eleazar the priest, who shall enquire for him by the judgement of the Urim before the Lord. At his word they shall go out, and at his word they shall come in, both he and all the people of Israel with him, the whole congregation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses did as the Lord commanded him. He took Joshua and made him stand before Eleazar the priest and the whole congregation,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he laid his hands on him and commissioned him as the Lord directed through Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Command the people of Israel and say to them, ‘My offering, my food for my food offerings, my pleasing aroma, you shall be careful to offer to me at its appointed time.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall say to them, This is the food offering that you shall offer to the Lord: two male lambs a year old without blemish, day by day, as a regular offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One lamb you shall offer in the morning, and the other lamb you shall offer at twilight;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: also a tenth of an ephah of fine flour for a grain offering, mixed with a quarter of a hin of beaten oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is a regular burnt offering, which was ordained at Mount Sinai for a pleasing aroma, a food offering to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Its drink offering shall be a quarter of a hin for each lamb. In the Holy Place you shall pour out a drink offering of strong drink to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The other lamb you shall offer at twilight. Like the grain offering of the morning, and like its drink offering, you shall offer it as a food offering, with a pleasing aroma to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On the Sabbath day, two male lambs a year old without blemish, and two tenths of an ephah of fine flour for a grain offering, mixed with oil, and its drink offering:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: this is the burnt offering of every Sabbath, besides the regular burnt offering and its drink offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “At the beginnings of your months, you shall offer a burnt offering to the Lord: two bulls from the herd, one ram, seven male lambs a year old without blemish;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: also three tenths of an ephah of fine flour for a grain offering, mixed with oil, for each bull, and two tenths of fine flour for a grain offering, mixed with oil, for the one ram;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a tenth of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering for every lamb; for a burnt offering with a pleasing aroma, a food offering to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their drink offerings shall be half a hin of wine for a bull, a third of a hin for a ram, and a quarter of a hin for a lamb. This is the burnt offering of each month throughout the months of the year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also one male goat for a sin offering to the Lord; it shall be offered besides the regular burnt offering and its drink offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On the fourteenth day of the first month is the Lord's Passover,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and on the fifteenth day of this month is a feast. For seven days shall unleavened bread be eaten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the first day there shall be a holy convocation. You shall not do any ordinary work,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but shall offer a food offering, a burnt offering to the Lord: two bulls from the herd, one ram, and seven male lambs a year old; see that they are without blemish;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: also their grain offering of fine flour mixed with oil; three tenths of an ephah shall you offer for a bull, and two tenths for a ram;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a tenth shall you offer for each of the seven lambs;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: also one male goat for a sin offering, to make atonement for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall offer these besides the burnt offering of the morning, which is for a regular burnt offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same way you shall offer daily, for seven days, the food of a food offering, with a pleasing aroma to the Lord. It shall be offered besides the regular burnt offering and its drink offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on the seventh day you shall have a holy convocation. You shall not do any ordinary work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On the day of the firstfruits, when you offer a grain offering of new grain to the Lord at your Feast of Weeks, you shall have a holy convocation. You shall not do any ordinary work,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but shall offer a burnt offering, with a pleasing aroma to the Lord: two bulls from the herd, one ram, seven male lambs a year old;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: also their grain offering of fine flour mixed with oil, three tenths of an ephah for each bull, two tenths for one ram,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a tenth for each of the seven lambs;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with one male goat, to make atonement for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Besides the regular burnt offering and its grain offering, you shall offer them and their drink offering. See that they are without blemish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On the first day of the seventh month you shall have a holy convocation. You shall not do any ordinary work. It is a day for you to blow the trumpets,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you shall offer a burnt offering, for a pleasing aroma to the Lord: one bull from the herd, one ram, seven male lambs a year old without blemish;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: also their grain offering of fine flour mixed with oil, three tenths of an ephah for the bull, two tenths for the ram,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one tenth for each of the seven lambs;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with one male goat for a sin offering, to make atonement for you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: besides the burnt offering of the new moon, and its grain offering, and the regular burnt offering and its grain offering, and their drink offering, according to the rule for them, for a pleasing aroma, a food offering to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On the tenth day of this seventh month you shall have a holy convocation and afflict yourselves. You shall do no work,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but you shall offer a burnt offering to the Lord, a pleasing aroma: one bull from the herd, one ram, seven male lambs a year old: see that they are without blemish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And their grain offering shall be of fine flour mixed with oil, three tenths of an ephah for the bull, two tenths for the one ram,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a tenth for each of the seven lambs:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: also one male goat for a sin offering, besides the sin offering of atonement, and the regular burnt offering and its grain offering, and their drink offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On the fifteenth day of the seventh month you shall have a holy convocation. You shall not do any ordinary work, and you shall keep a feast to the Lord for seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall offer a burnt offering, a food offering, with a pleasing aroma to the Lord, thirteen bulls from the herd, two rams, fourteen male lambs a year old; they shall be without blemish;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and their grain offering of fine flour mixed with oil, three tenths of an ephah for each of the thirteen bulls, two tenths for each of the two rams,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a tenth for each of the fourteen lambs;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: also one male goat for a sin offering, besides the regular burnt offering, its grain offering and its drink offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On the second day twelve bulls from the herd, two rams, fourteen male lambs a year old without blemish,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with the grain offering and the drink offerings for the bulls, for the rams, and for the lambs, in the prescribed quantities;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: also one male goat for a sin offering, besides the regular burnt offering and its grain offering, and their drink offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On the third day eleven bulls, two rams, fourteen male lambs a year old without blemish,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with the grain offering and the drink offerings for the bulls, for the rams, and for the lambs, in the prescribed quantities;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: also one male goat for a sin offering, besides the regular burnt offering and its grain offering and its drink offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On the fourth day ten bulls, two rams, fourteen male lambs a year old without blemish,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with the grain offering and the drink offerings for the bulls, for the rams, and for the lambs, in the prescribed quantities;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: also one male goat for a sin offering, besides the regular burnt offering, its grain offering and its drink offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On the fifth day nine bulls, two rams, fourteen male lambs a year old without blemish,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with the grain offering and the drink offerings for the bulls, for the rams, and for the lambs, in the prescribed quantities;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: also one male goat for a sin offering; besides the regular burnt offering and its grain offering and its drink offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On the sixth day eight bulls, two rams, fourteen male lambs a year old without blemish,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with the grain offering and the drink offerings for the bulls, for the rams, and for the lambs, in the prescribed quantities;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: also one male goat for a sin offering; besides the regular burnt offering, its grain offering, and its drink offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On the seventh day seven bulls, two rams, fourteen male lambs a year old without blemish,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with the grain offering and the drink offerings for the bulls, for the rams, and for the lambs, in the prescribed quantities;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: also one male goat for a sin offering; besides the regular burnt offering, its grain offering, and its drink offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On the eighth day you shall have a solemn assembly. You shall not do any ordinary work,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but you shall offer a burnt offering, a food offering, with a pleasing aroma to the Lord: one bull, one ram, seven male lambs a year old without blemish,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the grain offering and the drink offerings for the bull, for the ram, and for the lambs, in the prescribed quantities;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: also one male goat for a sin offering; besides the regular burnt offering and its grain offering and its drink offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “These you shall offer to the Lord at your appointed feasts, in addition to your vow offerings and your freewill offerings, for your burnt offerings, and for your grain offerings, and for your drink offerings, and for your peace offerings.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses told the people of Israel everything just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses spoke to the heads of the tribes of the people of Israel, saying, “This is what the Lord has commanded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man vows a vow to the Lord, or swears an oath to bind himself by a pledge, he shall not break his word. He shall do according to all that proceeds out of his mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a woman vows a vow to the Lord and binds herself by a pledge, while within her father's house in her youth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and her father hears of her vow and of her pledge by which she has bound herself and says nothing to her, then all her vows shall stand, and every pledge by which she has bound herself shall stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if her father opposes her on the day that he hears of it, no vow of hers, no pledge by which she has bound herself shall stand. And the Lord will forgive her, because her father opposed her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If she marries a husband, while under her vows or any thoughtless utterance of her lips by which she has bound herself,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and her husband hears of it and says nothing to her on the day that he hears, then her vows shall stand, and her pledges by which she has bound herself shall stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if, on the day that her husband comes to hear of it, he opposes her, then he makes void her vow that was on her, and the thoughtless utterance of her lips by which she bound herself. And the Lord will forgive her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (But any vow of a widow or of a divorced woman, anything by which she has bound herself, shall stand against her.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if she vowed in her husband's house or bound herself by a pledge with an oath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and her husband heard of it and said nothing to her and did not oppose her, then all her vows shall stand, and every pledge by which she bound herself shall stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if her husband makes them null and void on the day that he hears them, then whatever proceeds out of her lips concerning her vows or concerning her pledge of herself shall not stand. Her husband has made them void, and the Lord will forgive her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Any vow and any binding oath to afflict herself, her husband may establish, or her husband may make void.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if her husband says nothing to her from day to day, then he establishes all her vows or all her pledges that are upon her. He has established them, because he said nothing to her on the day that he heard of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if he makes them null and void after he has heard of them, then he shall bear her iniquity.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the statutes that the Lord commanded Moses about a man and his wife and about a father and his daughter while she is in her youth within her father's house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Avenge the people of Israel on the Midianites. Afterwards you shall be gathered to your people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses spoke to the people, saying, “Arm men from among you for the war, that they may go against Midian to execute the Lord's vengeance on Midian.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall send a thousand from each of the tribes of Israel to the war.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So there were provided, out of the thousands of Israel, a thousand from each tribe, twelve thousand armed for war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses sent them to the war, a thousand from each tribe, together with Phinehas the son of Eleazar the priest, with the vessels of the sanctuary and the trumpets for the alarm in his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They warred against Midian, as the Lord commanded Moses, and killed every male.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They killed the kings of Midian with the rest of their slain, Evi, Rekem, Zur, Hur, and Reba, the five kings of Midian. And they also killed Balaam the son of Beor with the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people of Israel took captive the women of Midian and their little ones, and they took as plunder all their cattle, their flocks, and all their goods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All their cities in the places where they lived, and all their encampments, they burned with fire,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and took all the spoil and all the plunder, both of man and of beast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they brought the captives and the plunder and the spoil to Moses, and to Eleazar the priest, and to the congregation of the people of Israel, at the camp on the plains of Moab by the Jordan at Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses and Eleazar the priest and all the chiefs of the congregation went to meet them outside the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses was angry with the officers of the army, the commanders of thousands and the commanders of hundreds, who had come from service in the war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses said to them, “Have you let all the women live?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, these, on Balaam's advice, caused the people of Israel to act treacherously against the Lord in the incident of Peor, and so the plague came among the congregation of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore, kill every male among the little ones, and kill every woman who has known man by lying with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But all the young girls who have not known man by lying with him keep alive for yourselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Encamp outside the camp for seven days. Whoever of you has killed any person and whoever has touched any slain, purify yourselves and your captives on the third day and on the seventh day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall purify every garment, every article of skin, all work of goats' hair, and every article of wood.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Eleazar the priest said to the men in the army who had gone to battle: “This is the statute of the law that the Lord has commanded Moses:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: only the gold, the silver, the bronze, the iron, the tin, and the lead,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: everything that can stand the fire, you shall pass through the fire, and it shall be clean. Nevertheless, it shall also be purified with the water for impurity. And whatever cannot stand the fire, you shall pass through the water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must wash your clothes on the seventh day, and you shall be clean. And afterwards you may come into the camp.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take the count of the plunder that was taken, both of man and of beast, you and Eleazar the priest and the heads of the fathers' houses of the congregation,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and divide the plunder into two parts between the warriors who went out to battle and all the congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And levy for the Lord a tribute from the men of war who went out to battle, one out of five hundred, of the people and of the oxen and of the donkeys and of the flocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take it from their half and give it to Eleazar the priest as a contribution to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And from the people of Israel's half you shall take one drawn out of every fifty, of the people, of the oxen, of the donkeys, and of the flocks, of all the cattle, and give them to the Levites who keep guard over the tabernacle of the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses and Eleazar the priest did as the Lord commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the plunder remaining of the spoil that the army took was 675,000 sheep,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: 72,000 cattle,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: 61,000 donkeys,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and 32,000 persons in all, women who had not known man by lying with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the half, the portion of those who had gone out in the army, numbered 337,500 sheep,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Lord's tribute of sheep was 675.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The cattle were 36,000, of which the Lord's tribute was 72.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The donkeys were 30,500, of which the Lord's tribute was 61.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The persons were 16,000, of which the Lord's tribute was 32 persons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses gave the tribute, which was the contribution for the Lord, to Eleazar the priest, as the Lord commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the people of Israel's half, which Moses separated from that of the men who had served in the army—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: now the congregation's half was 337,500 sheep,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: 36,000 cattle,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and 30,500 donkeys,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and 16,000 persons—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the people of Israel's half Moses took one of every 50, both of persons and of beasts, and gave them to the Levites who kept guard over the tabernacle of the Lord, as the Lord commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the officers who were over the thousands of the army, the commanders of thousands and the commanders of hundreds, came near to Moses
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to Moses, “Your servants have counted the men of war who are under our command, and there is not a man missing from us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we have brought the Lord's offering, what each man found, articles of gold, armlets and bracelets, signet rings, earrings, and beads, to make atonement for ourselves before the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses and Eleazar the priest received from them the gold, all crafted articles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the gold of the contribution that they presented to the Lord, from the commanders of thousands and the commanders of hundreds, was 16,750 shekels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (The men in the army had each taken plunder for himself.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses and Eleazar the priest received the gold from the commanders of thousands and of hundreds, and brought it into the tent of meeting, as a memorial for the people of Israel before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the people of Reuben and the people of Gad had a very great number of livestock. And they saw the land of Jazer and the land of Gilead, and behold, the place was a place for livestock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the people of Gad and the people of Reuben came and said to Moses and to Eleazar the priest and to the chiefs of the congregation,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Ataroth, Dibon, Jazer, Nimrah, Heshbon, Elealeh, Sebam, Nebo, and Beon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the land that the Lord struck down before the congregation of Israel, is a land for livestock, and your servants have livestock.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said, “If we have found favour in your sight, let this land be given to your servants for a possession. Do not take us across the Jordan.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Moses said to the people of Gad and to the people of Reuben, “Shall your brothers go to the war while you sit here?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why will you discourage the heart of the people of Israel from going over into the land that the Lord has given them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your fathers did this, when I sent them from Kadesh-barnea to see the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For when they went up to the Valley of Eshcol and saw the land, they discouraged the heart of the people of Israel from going into the land that the Lord had given them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord's anger was kindled on that day, and he swore, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Surely none of the men who came up out of Egypt, from twenty years old and upwards, shall see the land that I swore to give to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, because they have not wholly followed me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: none except Caleb the son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite and Joshua the son of Nun, for they have wholly followed the Lord.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord's anger was kindled against Israel, and he made them wander in the wilderness forty years, until all the generation that had done evil in the sight of the Lord was gone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, you have risen in your fathers' place, a brood of sinful men, to increase still more the fierce anger of the Lord against Israel!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if you turn away from following him, he will again abandon them in the wilderness, and you will destroy all this people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they came near to him and said, “We will build sheepfolds here for our livestock, and cities for our little ones,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but we will take up arms, ready to go before the people of Israel, until we have brought them to their place. And our little ones shall live in the fortified cities because of the inhabitants of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We will not return to our homes until each of the people of Israel has gained his inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we will not inherit with them on the other side of the Jordan and beyond, because our inheritance has come to us on this side of the Jordan to the east.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses said to them, “If you will do this, if you will take up arms to go before the Lord for the war,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and every armed man of you will pass over the Jordan before the Lord, until he has driven out his enemies from before him
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the land is subdued before the Lord; then after that you shall return and be free of obligation to the Lord and to Israel, and this land shall be your possession before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you will not do so, behold, you have sinned against the Lord, and be sure your sin will find you out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Build cities for your little ones and folds for your sheep, and do what you have promised.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people of Gad and the people of Reuben said to Moses, “Your servants will do as my lord commands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our little ones, our wives, our livestock, and all our cattle shall remain there in the cities of Gilead,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but your servants will pass over, every man who is armed for war, before the Lord to battle, as my lord orders.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses gave command concerning them to Eleazar the priest and to Joshua the son of Nun and to the heads of the fathers' houses of the tribes of the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said to them, “If the people of Gad and the people of Reuben, every man who is armed to battle before the Lord, will pass with you over the Jordan and the land shall be subdued before you, then you shall give them the land of Gilead for a possession.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, if they will not pass over with you armed, they shall have possessions among you in the land of Canaan.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people of Gad and the people of Reuben answered, “What the Lord has said to your servants, we will do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We will pass over armed before the Lord into the land of Canaan, and the possession of our inheritance shall remain with us beyond the Jordan.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses gave to them, to the people of Gad and to the people of Reuben and to the half-tribe of Manasseh the son of Joseph, the kingdom of Sihon king of the Amorites and the kingdom of Og king of Bashan, the land and its cities with their territories, the cities of the land throughout the country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people of Gad built Dibon, Ataroth, Aroer,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Atroth-shophan, Jazer, Jogbehah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beth-nimrah and Beth-haran, fortified cities, and folds for sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people of Reuben built Heshbon, Elealeh, Kiriathaim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nebo, and Baal-meon (their names were changed), and Sibmah. And they gave other names to the cities that they built.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Machir the son of Manasseh went to Gilead and captured it, and dispossessed the Amorites who were in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses gave Gilead to Machir the son of Manasseh, and he settled in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jair the son of Manasseh went and captured their villages, and called them Havvoth-jair.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Nobah went and captured Kenath and its villages, and called it Nobah, after his own name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the stages of the people of Israel, when they went out of the land of Egypt by their companies under the leadership of Moses and Aaron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses wrote down their starting places, stage by stage, by command of the Lord, and these are their stages according to their starting places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They set out from Rameses in the first month, on the fifteenth day of the first month. On the day after the Passover, the people of Israel went out triumphantly in the sight of all the Egyptians,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: while the Egyptians were burying all their firstborn, whom the Lord had struck down among them. On their gods also the Lord executed judgements.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the people of Israel set out from Rameses and camped at Succoth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they set out from Succoth and camped at Etham, which is on the edge of the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they set out from Etham and turned back to Pi-hahiroth, which is east of Baal-zephon, and they camped before Migdol.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they set out from before Hahiroth and passed through the midst of the sea into the wilderness, and they went a three days' journey in the wilderness of Etham and camped at Marah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they set out from Marah and came to Elim; at Elim there were twelve springs of water and seventy palm trees, and they camped there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they set out from Elim and camped by the Red Sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they set out from the Red Sea and camped in the wilderness of Sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they set out from the wilderness of Sin and camped at Dophkah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they set out from Dophkah and camped at Alush.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they set out from Alush and camped at Rephidim, where there was no water for the people to drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they set out from Rephidim and camped in the wilderness of Sinai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they set out from the wilderness of Sinai and camped at Kibroth-hattaavah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they set out from Kibroth-hattaavah and camped at Hazeroth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they set out from Hazeroth and camped at Rithmah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they set out from Rithmah and camped at Rimmon-perez.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they set out from Rimmon-perez and camped at Libnah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they set out from Libnah and camped at Rissah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they set out from Rissah and camped at Kehelathah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they set out from Kehelathah and camped at Mount Shepher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they set out from Mount Shepher and camped at Haradah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they set out from Haradah and camped at Makheloth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they set out from Makheloth and camped at Tahath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they set out from Tahath and camped at Terah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they set out from Terah and camped at Mithkah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they set out from Mithkah and camped at Hashmonah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they set out from Hashmonah and camped at Moseroth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they set out from Moseroth and camped at Bene-jaakan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they set out from Bene-jaakan and camped at Hor-haggidgad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they set out from Hor-haggidgad and camped at Jotbathah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they set out from Jotbathah and camped at Abronah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they set out from Abronah and camped at Ezion-geber.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they set out from Ezion-geber and camped in the wilderness of Zin (that is, Kadesh).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they set out from Kadesh and camped at Mount Hor, on the edge of the land of Edom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Aaron the priest went up Mount Hor at the command of the Lord and died there, in the fortieth year after the people of Israel had come out of the land of Egypt, on the first day of the fifth month.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Aaron was 123 years old when he died on Mount Hor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Canaanite, the king of Arad, who lived in the Negeb in the land of Canaan, heard of the coming of the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they set out from Mount Hor and camped at Zalmonah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they set out from Zalmonah and camped at Punon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they set out from Punon and camped at Oboth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they set out from Oboth and camped at Iye-abarim, in the territory of Moab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they set out from Iyim and camped at Dibon-gad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they set out from Dibon-gad and camped at Almon-diblathaim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they set out from Almon-diblathaim and camped in the mountains of Abarim, before Nebo.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they set out from the mountains of Abarim and camped in the plains of Moab by the Jordan at Jericho;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they camped by the Jordan from Beth-jeshimoth as far as Abel-shittim in the plains of Moab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spoke to Moses in the plains of Moab by the Jordan at Jericho, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to the people of Israel and say to them, When you pass over the Jordan into the land of Canaan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then you shall drive out all the inhabitants of the land from before you and destroy all their figured stones and destroy all their metal images and demolish all their high places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall take possession of the land and settle in it, for I have given the land to you to possess it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall inherit the land by lot according to your clans. To a large tribe you shall give a large inheritance, and to a small tribe you shall give a small inheritance. Wherever the lot falls for anyone, that shall be his. According to the tribes of your fathers you shall inherit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you do not drive out the inhabitants of the land from before you, then those of them whom you let remain shall be as barbs in your eyes and thorns in your sides, and they shall trouble you in the land where you dwell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will do to you as I thought to do to them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Command the people of Israel, and say to them, When you enter the land of Canaan (this is the land that shall fall to you for an inheritance, the land of Canaan as defined by its borders),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: your south side shall be from the wilderness of Zin alongside Edom, and your southern border shall run from the end of the Salt Sea on the east.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And your border shall turn south of the ascent of Akrabbim, and cross to Zin, and its limit shall be south of Kadesh-barnea. Then it shall go on to Hazar-addar, and pass along to Azmon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the border shall turn from Azmon to the Brook of Egypt, and its limit shall be at the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For the western border, you shall have the Great Sea and its coast. This shall be your western border.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This shall be your northern border: from the Great Sea you shall draw a line to Mount Hor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Mount Hor you shall draw a line to Lebo-hamath, and the limit of the border shall be at Zedad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the border shall extend to Ziphron, and its limit shall be at Hazar-enan. This shall be your northern border.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall draw a line for your eastern border from Hazar-enan to Shepham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the border shall go down from Shepham to Riblah on the east side of Ain. And the border shall go down and reach to the shoulder of the Sea of Chinnereth on the east.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the border shall go down to the Jordan, and its limit shall be at the Salt Sea. This shall be your land as defined by its borders all round.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses commanded the people of Israel, saying, “This is the land that you shall inherit by lot, which the Lord has commanded to give to the nine tribes and to the half-tribe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the tribe of the people of Reuben by fathers' houses and the tribe of the people of Gad by their fathers' houses have received their inheritance, and also the half-tribe of Manasseh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The two tribes and the half-tribe have received their inheritance beyond the Jordan east of Jericho, towards the sunrise.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “These are the names of the men who shall divide the land to you for inheritance: Eleazar the priest and Joshua the son of Nun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall take one chief from every tribe to divide the land for inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the names of the men: Of the tribe of Judah, Caleb the son of Jephunneh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the tribe of the people of Simeon, Shemuel the son of Ammihud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the tribe of Benjamin, Elidad the son of Chislon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the tribe of the people of Dan a chief, Bukki the son of Jogli.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the people of Joseph: of the tribe of the people of Manasseh a chief, Hanniel the son of Ephod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And of the tribe of the people of Ephraim a chief, Kemuel the son of Shiphtan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the tribe of the people of Zebulun a chief, Elizaphan the son of Parnach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the tribe of the people of Issachar a chief, Paltiel the son of Azzan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And of the tribe of the people of Asher a chief, Ahihud the son of Shelomi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the tribe of the people of Naphtali a chief, Pedahel the son of Ammihud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the men whom the Lord commanded to divide the inheritance for the people of Israel in the land of Canaan.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses in the plains of Moab by the Jordan at Jericho, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Command the people of Israel to give to the Levites some of the inheritance of their possession as cities for them to dwell in. And you shall give to the Levites pasture lands round the cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The cities shall be theirs to dwell in, and their pasture lands shall be for their cattle and for their livestock and for all their beasts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The pasture lands of the cities, which you shall give to the Levites, shall reach from the wall of the city outwards a thousand cubits all round.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall measure, outside the city, on the east side two thousand cubits, and on the south side two thousand cubits, and on the west side two thousand cubits, and on the north side two thousand cubits, the city being in the middle. This shall belong to them as pasture land for their cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The cities that you give to the Levites shall be the six cities of refuge, where you shall permit the manslayer to flee, and in addition to them you shall give forty-two cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the cities that you give to the Levites shall be forty-eight, with their pasture lands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as for the cities that you shall give from the possession of the people of Israel, from the larger tribes you shall take many, and from the smaller tribes you shall take few; each, in proportion to the inheritance that it inherits, shall give of its cities to the Levites.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to the people of Israel and say to them, When you cross the Jordan into the land of Canaan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then you shall select cities to be cities of refuge for you, that the manslayer who kills any person without intent may flee there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The cities shall be for you a refuge from the avenger, that the manslayer may not die until he stands before the congregation for judgement.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the cities that you give shall be your six cities of refuge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall give three cities beyond the Jordan, and three cities in the land of Canaan, to be cities of refuge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These six cities shall be for refuge for the people of Israel, and for the stranger and for the sojourner among them, that anyone who kills any person without intent may flee there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But if he struck him down with an iron object, so that he died, he is a murderer. The murderer shall be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if he struck him down with a stone tool that could cause death, and he died, he is a murderer. The murderer shall be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or if he struck him down with a wooden tool that could cause death, and he died, he is a murderer. The murderer shall be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The avenger of blood shall himself put the murderer to death; when he meets him, he shall put him to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if he pushed him out of hatred or hurled something at him, lying in wait, so that he died,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or in enmity struck him down with his hand, so that he died, then he who struck the blow shall be put to death. He is a murderer. The avenger of blood shall put the murderer to death when he meets him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But if he pushed him suddenly without enmity, or hurled anything on him without lying in wait
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or used a stone that could cause death, and without seeing him dropped it on him, so that he died, though he was not his enemy and did not seek his harm,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then the congregation shall judge between the manslayer and the avenger of blood, in accordance with these rules.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the congregation shall rescue the manslayer from the hand of the avenger of blood, and the congregation shall restore him to his city of refuge to which he had fled, and he shall live in it until the death of the high priest who was anointed with the holy oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the manslayer shall at any time go beyond the boundaries of his city of refuge to which he fled,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the avenger of blood finds him outside the boundaries of his city of refuge, and the avenger of blood kills the manslayer, he shall not be guilty of blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he must remain in his city of refuge until the death of the high priest, but after the death of the high priest the manslayer may return to the land of his possession.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And these things shall be for a statute and rule for you throughout your generations in all your dwelling places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If anyone kills a person, the murderer shall be put to death on the evidence of witnesses. But no person shall be put to death on the testimony of one witness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, you shall accept no ransom for the life of a murderer, who is guilty of death, but he shall be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall accept no ransom for him who has fled to his city of refuge, that he may return to dwell in the land before the death of the high priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not pollute the land in which you live, for blood pollutes the land, and no atonement can be made for the land for the blood that is shed in it, except by the blood of the one who shed it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not defile the land in which you live, in the midst of which I dwell, for I the Lord dwell in the midst of the people of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The heads of the fathers' houses of the clan of the people of Gilead the son of Machir, son of Manasseh, from the clans of the people of Joseph, came near and spoke before Moses and before the chiefs, the heads of the fathers' houses of the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said, “The Lord commanded my lord to give the land for inheritance by lot to the people of Israel, and my lord was commanded by the Lord to give the inheritance of Zelophehad our brother to his daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if they are married to any of the sons of the other tribes of the people of Israel, then their inheritance will be taken from the inheritance of our fathers and added to the inheritance of the tribe into which they marry. So it will be taken away from the lot of our inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the jubilee of the people of Israel comes, then their inheritance will be added to the inheritance of the tribe into which they marry, and their inheritance will be taken from the inheritance of the tribe of our fathers.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses commanded the people of Israel according to the word of the Lord, saying, “The tribe of the people of Joseph is right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what the Lord commands concerning the daughters of Zelophehad, ‘Let them marry whom they think best, only they shall marry within the clan of the tribe of their father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The inheritance of the people of Israel shall not be transferred from one tribe to another, for every one of the people of Israel shall hold on to the inheritance of the tribe of his fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And every daughter who possesses an inheritance in any tribe of the people of Israel shall be wife to one of the clan of the tribe of her father, so that every one of the people of Israel may possess the inheritance of his fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So no inheritance shall be transferred from one tribe to another, for each of the tribes of the people of Israel shall hold on to its own inheritance.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The daughters of Zelophehad did as the Lord commanded Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for Mahlah, Tirzah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Noah, the daughters of Zelophehad, were married to sons of their father's brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were married into the clans of the people of Manasseh the son of Joseph, and their inheritance remained in the tribe of their father's clan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the commandments and the rules that the Lord commanded through Moses to the people of Israel in the plains of Moab by the Jordan at Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator
